reviewText:
Early Access Review

Opening Disclaimer:Review Updated on 5/13/2016
This is quite obviously, an Early Access Title.

Eternal Crusade is Behaviour Interactive’s lovechild, with Namco Bandai as it’s publisher at the helm. Games Workshop is actually holding the reigns over everything on a tight fray, as this isn’t yet another one of those 40k games cranked out fast, for easy money. No sir. The amount of attention to detail, passion towards fidelity and all the neat quirks you’ll get to see will make even the most Lore-buff person smirk. Couple to that, the fact that the entire team working on it absolutely loves the setting and is no stranger to it, it’s easy to figure out we’re in for a treat from the get-go.

So, here are a few things you should probably expect from an Early Access Alpha title:
•	A metric ton of new players trying their best to figure out how the game plays
•	Performance Issues (Most of which are highly dependent of your Computer Setup, not the Unreal Engine itself being “unoptimized”, More on that later)
•	Frame Drops, again tied to your PC’s hardware.
•	Userbase making use of hilarious and/or annoying bugs
•	Flavor of the Month builds (Sometimes a new weapon is added for testing, and it needs heavy tweaking before they get it to it’s right niche slot.)
•	Incomplete Features, being gradually fixed / added and tested as the game progresses.
•	A random Crash-to-desktop here and there, complete with a bug-splat report system which you can describe your issue in order for devs to notice and hotfix if they are able to reproduce your bug, step by step.

If these things don’t scare you, I’m sure you’ll be able to drum up enjoyment out of it. Let me take the time to answer the question of “Is it worth the money?”, because that’s what everyone wants to basically get out of these reviews.

Having played this game before it hit steam, in it’s primordial, pre-alpha stage, with missing assets and features, I can say it has come a very long way. The game has evolved into a beautiful Lobby-based shooter, aiming towards a righteous mix between the old Space Marine game and Planetside 2.

If you remember the Warhammer 40k Space Marine game, and had as much fun with it as I had in the Multiplayer scene, then you should know that the potential in Eternal Crusade far exceeds that. Not only through sheer virtue of a better engine, but variety! Which one of you hasn’t dreamt of playing an Ork or Eldar, pitted against Loyalist or Chaos Space Marines? You’ll get to do that in Eternal Crusade, fairly soon too.

If you’re not adverse to the “Testing phase” of a game, and if you can handle the odd bug here and there, balance issues that will occur inadvertently as content is laden across with each patch, then you’ll surely want to be part of this wonderful, ever-growing community and get in on the visceral action of what’s already turning out to be a fun, great game.

Warhammer 40,000: Eternal Crusade is a Third Person, Sci-fi MMO Combat-Shooter. Most of the action is obviously PVP oriented, squad-based gameplay with friendly fire in full effect, my friend Eihger did a wonderful job outlining the basics of Tactics in this game here.[forum.eternalcrusade.com]

Aside from the basic, over-the-shoulder third person ranged combat, the game has dedicated a lot of attention and emphasis on providing the players with a glorious melee combat system which makes the game feel like a distant, more able-bodied cousin of Space Marine.

The Developers based the principles of melee combat around a simple, skill-based system of “Rock papers Scissors”, featuring an array of different attacks you can perform such as Fast, Heavy and Defensive strikes. Each with their own separate set of animations. The System is explained in depth here.[forum.eternalcrusade.com]

There are currently two factions readily available for play out of the advertised, playable 4 :

•	Space Marines
•	Chaos Space Marines
•	Eldar [Still in Development]
•	Orkz [Still in Development]

Each faction has five sub-factions, or “clans” to choose from(Initially there were 4, now we’re up to 5, and they will keep adding on as time goes on.)

These Sub-factions not only offer you unique looks, through the virtue of representation and planned customization, but they will dole out a unique bonus to your progression tree or add a certain distinction to a specific class such as aesthetics, possibly a unique skill or ability. For example, The Blood Angel Apothecary is known as a “Sanguinary Priest” whilst the Space Wolves have a unique variation/blend called “Wolf Priest” which, is, essentially a Chaplain and Apothecary rolled into one.

There is a cash shop on the website called “The Rogue Trader Store” and it’s purely for Vanity Gear and cosmetics, not yet implemented for testing, this will no doubt stem into the game’s already planned character customization system which stems with deep inspiration from Space Marine. http://imgur.com/a/gUpDM

Performance Issues
The game just received a massive Performance Optimization patch on 12th of May.

I have played this game on two different computers, with two different connections.

My first computer in Europe, Romania, http://i.imgur.com/95EitiL.png ran the game semi-fluid, with the graphic setting to “max” [Which isn’t much to say about at the moment as the slider has only 4 “bumps” you can choose from, which gradually increase or decrease a slew of effects] with FPS ratings ranging from low 25-55, depending on how much carnage was displayed on screen. It was a fairly enjoyable experience, aside from suffering a lag spike here and there due to my ISP being shoddy or the Eternal Crusade servers being located within NA.

2nd computer, in Canada http://i.imgur.com/gjwG31k.png  , runs the game flawlessly, without a single hitch. I’ve got absolutely no complaints and can’t wait to see the Graphics settings tabs updated for further tweaking. If you’re a performance junkie like me, and like to tinker and tweak for optimum efficiency or visuals, you can go into the game’s .ini files and edit them manually via GameUserSettings.ini (located here:C:\Users\YOUR_NAME_HERE"\AppData\Local\EternalCrusade\Saved\Config\WindowsClient)

In Closing or TL;DR
The development team behind the game is open and shares their thoughts with the community at large via forums
date: they answer questions and generally interact with the populace. They offer a livestream every Friday for general QA
recommended: and play alongside the community on the servers. There is even an achievement for managing to kill a developer in-game

voteText: to me

votesTotal: vanity crap like pets or lore breaking content. The bug exploits and general game-breaking content get hotfixed instantly or as soon as humanly possible with the push out of a new patch.\n\nThe team actively takes suggestions from the community and implements them if they’re sound and make enough sense
votesFunny: like the 5th subfaction choice which was decided via vote.\n\nSo

reviewText:
Early Access Review

2/16/2016

I think I'll rewrite this review now, as you can see, I still have the game as not recommended. Just because I feel this game is too early to really enjoyably play. Some optimization has rolled out, and it seems to be heading in the general right direction. But I say, support these devs when this game comes out, they're already fully funded, so you shouldn't feel the obligation to toss your money at them just yet. If you REALLY want to give them money, I would say hell yeah, don't let me stop you. But I'm just putting this as a warning, don't be surprised when the game runs like sludge and everything is horrible looking and there's bugs everywhere. Because that's what I'm trying to get across. I've spent 120 DOLLARS on this game as a captain's level founder and I've yet to even get a proper game session in because of how badly it runs. But I accept this as part of the unoptimized crud that comes with an alpha build. I feel this game is going to be good when it comes out, but right now, my personal recommendation is to wait. After all, this is my opinion, not yours, and EVERYONE has one.  So if you feel so strongly against my thoughts, feel free to ignore them and buy the game. But as always, caveat emptor!


PROS

It's Warhammer 40k (If you're new to the franchise then, feel free to enlighten yourself, it's top tier stuff.)

It's building off of Relic's Space Marine's design

It's deviating away from the basic MMO format (despite me generally loving that format, I like new things) I.e. no floating exclamation mark quest givers, real objectives, real challenge. (That's the plan anyways, right now its just a team based shooter with no open world, that will start to flow in later)

The devs seem passionate about the franchise, all of their Into the Warp" DevSpeak livestreams show their love of the universe.

The models seem generally faithful to the 40k design. (Some exceptions

Cons (Sort Of)

Almost everything about the game right now. It shows INSANE promise

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't know if I would recommend this game; what I do know is that I would NOT recommend Early Access to this game. Not even to WH40K fans.

The problem with this Early Access is that its too early. Way too early. Developers are struggling to get the absolute basics of this game off the ground. To give you a clue: I've been playtesting since closed alpha and they are still trying to get melee to work.

Note that I am not complaining about bugs, glithes or bad performance - all of which are to be expected in Early Access. I am talking about the underlying design of the core combat experience"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me start by saying this game has supplied me with hours of fun. As a huge Warhammer fan this game is going to be something amazing. I’ve been following the development from day one and what they have in store for us once the game is fully released is going to be fantastic, a dream come true for me: a 40k MMO.

Please be aware that this game is still in an Alpha build as I’m writing this, which means you will come across bugs with the sound and visual aspects. The developers themselves do weekly patches to address these issues, they supply us with a weekly production updates via Twitch where we can see all the new features that will be coming, and they listen to people's concerns and make sure they answer the questions people put towards them about game features and the game's future. For us who have been following this game, we know that once the game is released it will receive FREE expansions periodically (every three months) that will give players new content and abilities. The first expansion planned will add Terminators into the game!

There is performance issues at this time but the Developers are aware and are fixng the issues!

At this early stage, the MMO aspect is slowly being put into the game. Please don't confuse this with an MMO such as World of Warcraft with quests lines etc, when I speak of the MMO aspect I'm talking about the Massive Multiplayer part. At this current stage we only have 16v16 player matches, but that is soon to change, and tests have already begun of upping the numbers and creating more massive epic battles, I was lucky enough to take part in one of these tests and the increased player count made the game an absolute pleasure, it turned it into what 40k truly is, an epic battlefield. The next map to be added is going to be a huge fortress that will feature 60 players (30vs30).

The character progression system has started to be put into the game, the first stage of this has already been added with the character loadout menu where you can customize your classes by selecting what guns and perks to give them. They’ve also introduced the first stages of character progressive XP, at the moment it’s capped at only to level 10 but it’s laid the foundation to be built on.

I could go on about certain classes and give you feedback but I think it would be best to give you visual references so you can see what you’re getting at this stage of development. I have put together a small collection on some of the Space Marine classes here.

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFznDVzkakEzzlqu5PxET46ZmVFJrh76L

Here you will find videos from me just messing around in the game from my Twitch Streams. It shows the basic gameplay and some teamwork.

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFznDVzkakExSuFd5TVJ2qOoMfbV0PbGo

Also keep you can keep track of all the posts from the Developers:

http://www.battle-brothers.net/devtrack

If you think I’ve helped you and you’ve decided to buy the game from my review, you can use my referral code (4000 free extra Rogue Trader points for both you and me): EC-3VMHIXL6DLZ8J

For the Emperor!

date: It is a hogwash of a shooter experience. Why? Let me list

All of this is made much worse with the design decision for player corpses to create collision positive ragdolls. Just executed a guy in a remotely tight room and/or in a corridor? reviewText:
Early Access Review

In short: This is not another crap WH40k game trying to make easy money. There is a lot of love being poured into this game and the Eternal Crusade team members are big WH40k fans.


The game is in Alpha!
Things you can expect from a game in Alpha:Lag and/or latency.
Random crashes.
Hilarious and/or annoying bugs.
Missing or incomplete features.
Frame drops.
Optimizations problems.
People abusing game exploits.
New players that have no idea how to play the game.

Is the game worth buying?
This is the big question that everybody wants an answer to.

If you were not scared off by the things listed above, the answer is yes!

Honestly, the best value for your money was in the Founder's packs, but you will not regret the investment if you purchase this game.


What makes this game special?
After observing the EC team since the days when their streams were nothing more than a few guys sitting down, drinking beers, and talking about what they would like the game to be, this is what I can say about it all:
The team is working with Games Workshop to make sure everything meets their requirements.
The team really takes in the community comments. It even let the community decide what the 5th sub-faction for each faction will be.
The team interacts with the community all the time. Not only on the forum and during the official EC live stream, but they regularly visit other people's streams to talk to everybody.
They constantly fix bug and exploits. The level designer was watching two different live streams of mine and started fixing problems right there and then as I was showing them to him.
This game is not throwing WH40k content together to attract buyers. In fact, it refuses to add content that would break the WH40k lore. They take this very seriously.
Rather than rushing the game, the team is taking it slow because they want to do everything right before adding new content.
The team has always been open about the development of the game and has shared everything with the community.

About the game in general
People keep asking me what I would compare this game to. I always answer with:
It wants to be like PlanetSide2 with WH40k, but it is not there yet.
Currently, it's closer to Battlefield. It will even have a conquest map(later).

Factions/races that will be in for release:
Space Marines
Chaos Space Marines
Eldar
OrkzThere will be five sub-factions(chapters) for each faction(race) with possible more of each coming after official release.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So this game has been teased in dark parts of in the internet for quite some time now. For those that have followed it, they've sent turbulence and upheaval not unlike an average day on Cadia. It's now to come to the Steam community for Early Access. How does it stack up? Take note this review will change based on the evolution of the game.

As of February 14:

As much as I don't want to say this, I cannot recommend this game to the average Steam user. This ISN'T all the fault of the developers, however to the average Steam user that would not matter. To begin with, the Developers are reporting a UI bug tied to the Unreal 4 engine the game is built on that, they claim, is taking away an ENTIRE 20 FPS from normal gameplay. To continue, Unreal 4 has known issues with AMD Products, that's made especially clear with this game. Again, that's a matter with the engine, however that is something to consider.

Otherwise, the game is currently CPU heavy, therefore even excellent graphics cards will have mixed results with the current build as is. I personally get 20 FPS on a good day. The game would need to need to have its average performance increase a bit before I'd find it acceptable. Of course if that UI issue mentioned was cleared up maybe we'd be in a different ball game.

So, what about the game itself? This game is built to be a MMO3PS. The size of the battles are supposed to increase in time, but the current build limits to 16v16 in a lobby shooter. There is no valuable progression installed yet and the advertisement of Four factions and 20 subfactions is currently a dream. There are currently 2 Factions: The Space Marines and the Chaos Space Marines, and 6 subfactions.  That'll naturally make people scream WHAT ABOUT THQ'S SPACE MARINE?! That's valid, however the game plays far differently then SM, Cover is a lot more important and many would argue you're generally a bit more fragile (Except Melee which I'll get to) as well as squad based teamwork. As many will find, organized groups will be able to absolutely wreck PUGs. As in, it won't even be fun. There is in game voice communication, however it is currently rudimentary and lacking. The team is trying to make a game where KDR isn't everything, but as you might see from the score screen, it's still there, which means even if you do ridiculously well in that tree, you might not be first place since Objectives and support mean so much more.

Gunplay is getting there, it's fairly solid. The biggest issue is a perceived Low TTK, however thre are a bunch of factors influencing that, including Lag and the unoptimised state of the game right now. I personally find it alright. Currently All Vehicles are set to be Anti-infantry including an AutoCannon equipped Predator Tank. There are already several ways to effectively engage vehicles from an infantry position. Most would consider Vehicles too easy to kill on the smallish maps that are currently housing engagements.

Melee is of course where this game seeks to establish itself. The classics are already in, so if you want a Power Axe, Baddabing Badda Boom, good to go. The melee system works on a Rock Paper Scissors approach. Quick attacks will beat Power Attacks, Power Attacks beat the 'Defensive Bash' or a counter attack, and the Defensive bash stops Quick Attacks. To further deepen the system the 'heavier' the weapon the more effective it is when attacks connect eventually leading to a stagger upon frequent 'clashes.' It's a reasonably decent system, the main problem with melee is that as soon as you get off the skill floor, and learn these mechanics, the sky is the LIMIT. Obscene KDRs are possible mostly due to two buffs on Melee focused characters: A damage incoming decrease and a Life Steal. As soon as you keep connecting with something any less than three people focusing you will NOT take you down in current builds.

Overall, even though there are three maps, there are people that can play the game for hours upon days, it's definitely fun if you can play it. However, I don't believe the vast majority of the Steam Base can currently do so, and while I love the game. I cannot in good faith recommend it. I can however mention that the Developers are firmly invested in the game. Every Friday on their twitch channel twitch.tv/40kcrusade they provide status reports on what they're working on and will answer questions from the community. I very much like that and I will continue to follow this game because I do believe in it, but I will not recommend it now.

tl;dr Version - Good ideas, Decent gunplay, Good developer, do not get right now if using an AMD system, Two factions, low overall performance, cannot recommend.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is currently in Alpha so don't expect balance or optimization to be 100%, even if it was in Beta they are still going to be testing it up until launch.  That being said this game is fun in its current iteration, at least I find it fun.  If you are interested in this game ask yourself a few questions.

Do you like Warhammer 40k IP?
Do you like the Space Marines game?
Are you patient and willing to actually test the game?
Can you handle imbalances in the game for the sake of testing purposes?
Do you want to be part of a growing community and get in on the ground floor of what could turn out to be a great game?

If you answered yes to those than you should read this.

https://www.eternalcrusade.com/news/480-State-Of-The-Crusade-IV

That is what they are wanting to do, and if they accomplish it, this will be a really awesome game.  Right now they have a lobby shooter that they are adding more and more to.

Watch this.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oW3Xn4-Vf4s

After reading that and you are wanting to purchase the game you can use my referral code EC-543AUYORC9A7E to get yourself more RTP points (4k RTP points) for the store when it opens up. The devs so far have stated that it will be side grades and cosmetic items.

After purchasing the game, you should view these links.

http://forum.eternalcrusade.com/threads/temporary-fps-solution.50043/page-31#post-1039241

That thread will help you gain FPS and make the game much more enjoyable, it is currently not optimized so you will have to tweak an .ini file to get the most out of it.

https://forum.eternalcrusade.com/threads/tips-and-tricks.47140/

This one is on the Founder's thread so you might not be able to view it but it has some great tips and hints.

http://forum.eternalcrusade.com/threads/tips-i-want-the-newbies-to-know.51317/

This one is in the general section and anyone can view it, very helpful information in there.

http://forum.eternalcrusade.com/threads/pinkys-alpha-melee-guide.50629/

Updated melee info!

http://forum.eternalcrusade.com/threads/melee-combat-rules.52694/

This will help you get a grasp on melee in the game, believe me this will help you even as ranged.

Don't be shy to ask questions to the community as well, most people are willing to answer questions.

I recommend this game but only if you are willing to participate in TESTING the game.  If you don't have the patience than I would wait until they release it in a more complete form.

EDIT:  I will be adding the new stuff they have added to the EA server here since I posted this review.

So far the biggest addition is the fortress map which is 30v30 and pretty epic in scale.  The defenders have a limited amount of spawns and have to defend for a certain amount of time.

They added a global map that shows progression of a faction based on wins, this is the beginning of them adding conquest.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In its current condition I can only recommend this game to the most hardcore 40k fans.


In my opinion the current alpha is missing far too many features to appeal to anyone else - you're not even able to choose what map you wish to deploy for, you simply queue up and the game throws you into a match.
Even changing keybindings must be done through editing the game files.
Voicechat is there, but there's no indication of who's speaking nor is there any way to mute players at the moment.

Several people have reported the game to be practically unplayable for them for one reason or the other and I certainly believe it - the game was unplayable for me for a good while, only turning playable some time ago and even so required me to seriously turn down the graphics and resolution.
Personally I'm absolutely fine with doing so as I'm not very graphics-driven but people with powerful gaming computers may wish to take this into account before purchasing to avoid disappointment.
And, in fairness to the game, it's not quite optimized in its current state yet - that will follow later.

As other reviews have mentioned the melee is also a little confusing at the moment but it certainly works although some people have reported it causing FPS drops for them - I also experienced that until a few updates ago but have since had much fun and success playing the melee classes.

I've not used vehicles personally aside from using my squad's Rhino as a spawn point but from what I've witnessed they work well, save perhaps seeming to be a little too lightweight (I've seen Rhinos roll over Predators like the tank was a bump in the road) and perhaps being able to soak up too much damage - it takes many lascannon shots to blow up a Rhino, more so to demolish the Predator though that may be the case to keep the vehicles viable battlefield options that require several Devastators/Havocs to counter.

The weapons themselves all feel viable options save maybe for the lascannon which you shouldn't take unless you're planning on being solely in the long-distance anti-vehicle role (granted you can also snipe enemies that stand still with it) as it has a build-up before firing and requires you to hold a target in the crosshair to actually build up the shot meaning that if your target moves fast you're not likely to get that shot off before they put a bolter round or chainsword in you and at the moment Devastators and Havocs have no sidearm option, meaning your heavy weapon will be your only weapon.

I've only experienced a single crash which may have been my own fault due to alt-tabbing during the postgame stats screen so for an alpha the game's been surprisingly stable.

My last gripe with the game is that currently there's no detailed graphical settings which leaves me without a gamma/brightness slider, causing one level (Pegasus Station) to be so dark I can barely see anything.
I've met one other player who experienced the same issue as well so a word of warning that you too might end up going blind in that level, though the odds appear somewhat low.

All in all, for a 40k fan this game might well be worth it even in its current alpha state.
For a general online shooter fan, there likely are other, finished games available already.

Personally I've still found the gameplay enjoyable and like the game. But I'm not reviewing this for myself.
So you should very, very carefully consider the points the reviews here make and the fact that this is VERY Early Access, meaning there will very likely be issues.

But for me, well..

The moment when you rush across an open battlefield with autocannon and bolter shells flying through the air, a few of the latter glancing off your armour as you reach your injured battle-brother to help him up, after which the two of you take a second to ready your bolters and catch your breath before charging towards near-certain death together..

.. that's Warhammer 40'000.


The Emperor protects.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Update April 24th - new build, new map!!

I have been with the Crusade for a while now, had my fun, frustration and victories.


but what is EC? Well, it's a 3rd person shooter set in the Warhammer 40.000 universe.
choose between 4 factions, of which are currently available, and massacre each other for objectives.

Supposedly it will evolve into a form of MMORPG with a world map to fight over. lets see if that will happen :)
and with the new update, at least the world map is there for looks, if not yet implemented into the game

Pros:
- 40k setting is beautifully realized. the initial three maps are well designed and give plenty of opportunities for teamplay
- looks good, runs relatively smoothely (there's a lag though) ... since the last update EC runs even smoother. the FPS drop has gone down significantly for my machine and the overall graphics have been improved.
The new update has improved massively on the performance! I can now ramp it up a little without loosing performance
- fun weapons, all lore. Chainsword, Bolters, Meltagun and more.
- squad and class based combat, this really makes a difference. lone wolves normally do not last long, your brothers are your lifeline.
- it's tough as ♥♥♥♥ing nails. don't expect this to be an easy killing spree
- rewarding to play in nearly any role
Take objectives as a Tactical Marine, destroy vehicles as demolitionist, strike fear into the heart of your enemies by surging down on jetpacks with the Raptor/Assault class
- loadout customization. many would yawn at that, but you get to earn gear and aestetics, some with a kick, some for the looks. but it's all pure 40k :)
- character progression. earn XP, not by killing, but mostly through capturing, interuppting or assisting your team (seriously, you can easily get to the 2nd or 3rd place on a match with being a teamplayer ;)
- community is so far nice and friendly
- 4 Factions: Space Marines and Chaos Space Marines are currentlye playable
Eldar and Orcs are on their way to join battle
- I feel that melee combat has improved quite a bit. it is more fluent and rewarding and a real option in tight situations
- frequent updates rolling in. expect maps, new races and vehicles and stuffs and things!


Cons:
- Devs are rather slow when contacted and I find it funny that a threat for a new update goes on absolutely unmoderated for weeks ... and while that is still an issue, they at least work themselves through the backlog (just be patient)
- can get very frustrating if the teams are unbalanced or you play with egocentric K/D fanatics.
Update!!
the servers seems quite populated right now. plenty of action yet it feels as if the   expertise in
the community has gone down rather than up
My tip: follow any player with a PG upfront :P

- maps are too damn small and not many out yet. but fun meat grinders that will challenge your witts and bravery
Update!!
the newest map offers the chance for 30vs30 matches, quite fun
- Early Access, but it is taking a more and more definite shape over the last few months
- no Tau :/ (yeah, I'll be waiting)
- wonky,, wonky controls, I feel that gamepad users are left in the cold here. it offers the pad as input yet the controlls are less than optimal especially on the selection screen
- the spawn points ... this has gotten slightly better, but with the last update it has become a pain to select spawn points with a 360 controller
- the selection screen is one godawful piece of work ... you see chats, but are unable to interact in any fashion. the navigation is sloppy and some inputs don't work on the pad, yaaay
- still no spectator mode, at least let us follow our own faction. especially when the spawns run.

Verdict:

It's work in progress, sure, but it already packs quite a punch and shapes up to hit you several times afterwards.
it definitely offers a good combat experience and should be observed, at least, by any 40k fan that wants to build his own character to slaughter in the Emperor's name.
If you are unsure about early access games, wait a little, see how it will turn out.
I for myself got a lot of fun and fight for my buck and will continue to play ;)
And over the last weeks there has been a steady improvement on the game, the tweaks are noticable and serve the evolution of the crusade.


I will see you on Arkohna, brothers and Xeno scum

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, so the first thing to note is that this game has good, solid gameplay. I genuinely enjoy running around and fighting in this game. From the streams I'd seen of it, I didn't expect that, but I wanted to jump in before the founder programme ended, so impulse purchased.

I am VERY excited to see where this game ends up, and they have BIG plans.

With that said... You need a BEAST of a computer. This is a hugely unoptimised game.
But we're all in the master race here with GTX980s, so let's assume that's not an issue! It's buggy. Don't expect some blizzard level of polish for an alpha test here. The UI isn't intuitive. They've just added in a new loadout scheme, which I very much hope they change as it's simply bad.
I would argue that they went on to Steam too early.

With that said, if you have a computer that can handle it and you like warhammer then this is a MUST BUY game. Also, get this bad boy on your wishlists, because it is clearly going to be an amazing game. A bit of optimisation, and a tutorial, a few bug fixes, and this would be an amazing game in its own right.
But that's not all they're going to do! The gameplay is solid, and enjoyable. They'll be adding PvE, open world, MMO, everything. And that's around the good core they've got.

GREAT GAME, BUY IT NOW, PLAY IT IN 6 MONTHS

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Space Marines and the Chaos Space Marines are engaged in a fierce battle, with the Chaos pushing back the multiple chapters of the Emperor's finest soldiers.

Men die around me, I see them get executed by foes.
We are disorganized and losing... our battle brothers crawl away from the heretics... but suddenly, a young commander rallies up everyone and makes them hold down the stairs to the fortress, the heretics start dropping before us but their push is hard and eventually we find ourselves fighting inside the halls of the fortress. Plasma beams and bolter fire everywhere, men getting chopped up by chainswords and blown up by grenades. The Space Marines give everything they've got, taking down numerous assaulting enemy forces, but the Chaos Space Marines don't give up easy and they push even harder, slaughtering our commander and numerous battle brothers.

I am the last man standing, using my plasma gun I immediately dispatch foes attempting to capture the objective, suddenly an assault traitor flanks me, I throw a grenade at the ground and roll away, blowing him up. The Emperor has truly blessed me. A devastator comes from behind, he lands in a few hits from his bolter before I kill him with my knife, and then a swarm of Chaos Space Marines move towards me and finish me off.

As I slowly crawl away, a heretic slowly approaches me, calls me a puny loyalist and then performs an execution move with his power sword. The Space Marines lose the battle.

10/10 would feel immersed in the WH40K world again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game runs on Unreal Engine 4 and as such it's still unoptimised so be very carefull when you decide to give it a shot.

Remember that Space Marine game where you played as a Smurf"? Remember the multiplayer? Now imagine that but on a larger scale.

- So far the battles are 16v16 + Predator Tanks and Rhinos.
- You can only play as Chaos Space Marines or Space Marines.
- The graphics options are limited to a silly slider with preset setting (however you can edit the GameUserSettings.ini file in C:\Users\UserName\AppData\Local\EternalCrusade\Saved\Config\WindowsClient to get some more FPS)

If you are a die hard WH 40K fan and you can't wait to either fight for the Emprah or Get some skulls for that skull throne I very much recomend it but if you expect a well optimised and future complete game I advise to wait at least 1-2 months. This isn't Alpha/Beta that we are used to by "AAA" developers this is THE ALPHA.

The only gripe I have so far with the game is that you cant really switch shoulder camera from left to right etc. and there is no FOV slider at the moment.

My rig:

- GTX 970
- 8GB RAM 1600MHz
- i7 4790k 4.0GHz
- And the game is installed on Samsung EVO 840 SSD

I'm getting 40-60 FPS with occasionall dips to 20-30 FPS (depending on the map) so far there is only one map that will let you play at stable 60FPS."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATE: They fixed the performance issues. The game runs a lot better now!

As of February 8, 2016 I was able to find many full games. I will update if I ever stop finding matches (the problem with EA multiplayer titles.)

This is probably the tightest Tactical Third Person Shooter I've played since Gears of War. The gunplay FEELS TIGHT. And the Melee is as powerful as it should be. Personally I think there is a GREAT balance between all of the current weapons (subject to change as development continues.)

I love the feel of playing a Marine, the weight to the charaacter and power of his movement, sprint, and melee just feels so right.

I am incredibly excited to see where development goes, and could see myself playing this game almost exclusively once an optimization patch is made and released.

I would not recommend this game right now, In the future it may be a good game, but as of right now there is a great deal of flaws, the setting menu is that of a Xbox game rather than a PC game. Update review: You can disable Bloom by typing in %appdata% going to local folder, eternalcrusade, saved, config, windowsclient, gameusersettings, - Change sg.PostProcessQuality=2 to sg.PostProcessQuality=0

Being able to disable Bloom, has helped the pains this game was causing. Now if I could just play with my friends I could turn this review into a posative rather than a negative. Would help if bloom options where in the setting menu rather than outside of the game however.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Eternal crusade is a game very much in the vein of Space Marine. If you liked the third person shooter with nearly equal melee set in the 41st millennium emphasis you will probably enjoy this game. I became a early founder and spent a good deal of time slaying other  heretics and loyalist for months. The announcement of this title coming to early access has some perks but was also controversial for those in the community.  I will share some of the positive and negative points around this game as they have decided to enter early access here on steam.

I will start by stating I think this game has some promise but at this moment in early access the game suffers from some big issues.

Firstly, the game was initially sold as to be a much larger more MMO experience with assurances of being hundreds of people participating in battles along with tactical combat." Unfortunately the game has stepped back from some of these features and been reduced to smaller maps with slower development. As it stands it is mostly a match making lobby shooter with a couple dozen players on opposing Space Marine vs Chaos classes. There is also a limited selection of vehicles like rhino transports
date: predator tanks... with possible units like siege tanks and far far later dreadnoughts (maybe). No speeders or bikes as of yet. Maps are somewhat larger than Space Marine
recommended: but probably smaller than say Battlefield. A big disappointment for me is the current lack of other factions: Eldar and Orks. Eldar have been briefly teased with in game footage and also some vids showing the motion capture work. Orks? Well very little to nothing. Forum polls also show space marines lead in popularity (surprise) over the other faction choices... so expect many many space marines running about (and can be seen with wait times and population in matches currently). Tyranids will be some sort of PVE experience and also a sort of equalizer for the clear population imbalance this game has.\n\nPerformance is the biggest hive tyrant in the room currently as through the near entirety of close founder access has been very poor. As in 25-35 FPS depending on system (some with high end systems will report poor performance). There has been some advancement and bug squashing to remedy this and there has been some positive gains in the 10-20 FPS bringing the game to a playable state. I personally get solid 35-60 fps varying by map and amount of players. I have a I7 3770k and 770 gtx SC for those wondering. The developers have promised some more future effort to polish up optimization and also hiring a new developer to work on improvements. But since the game is technically still alpha expect drastic reductions in FPS or bugs
hoursPlayed:
obviously to be present.

Gameplay is fluctuating beast. One week you may find a class or loadout clearly OP. For example the stormbolter produced weeks of cheesy easy kills as people could be mowed down by this weapon. Another recent week we faced Nurgle marines who could easily slice through groups of players. Melee is constantly a tug of war mix of testing percentages vs. survival rates and TTK. Ultimately this game is supposed to be rock scissors papers but also emphasis on cooperative "tactical" gameplay with squads and factions. So I suppose for now don't get hung up on seeing people with 40 /5 K/D as a specific class. Shooting is just OK in the game (no FPS mode) and I find the melee to be rather poor. Battles as of now are mostly just capturing points like any other common shooter anyway. The balance issues are being tackled so you will see some silly things and things are in flux.

The graphics do not much impress unfortunately. I think this is both a limitation for trying to cram as many players into the unreal engine but also the fact this game will eventually be ported to consoles. So not really a PC masterrace sort of experience to be had here. They are working to get the latest builds of Unreal into the game as they come online
voteText:
so I would expect continued advancement in the fidelity and effects of the game though.

Audio and music is good enough. Weapons sound punchy and the music is fitting with typical space marine speech.

In some ways this reminds me of Mechwarrior Online and their access program. The devs however for eternal crusade are VERY communicative and engaged with the community.  They are listening
helpfulPercent: providing weekly streams with updates and also popping into alternative channels like twitch streams hosting the game. With luck things will continue to pick up over the coming months and we will see if they can hold to their updated promises.\n\nIn closing
votesHelpful: I gave own honest insights into the game for potential new customers and also for the developers. New players: if you like 40k and more importantly space marine I think this game might be for you. Anyone outside of this sphere may find the game lacking and frustrating as it continues forward through development. Shooters are a crowded space and there are usually only so many people are willing to devote oneself to playing. For now
votesTotal: expect a very basic average lobby based shooter with some melee and two near identical factions.\n\nHopefully this limited situation does not persist for much longer and the game opens up with new factions

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is NOWHERE NEAR COMPLETE. Full disclosure, this is an Indie studio trying to eventually make a AAA game. You are not going to get near all the features that you want at this point in the game. This is in early, EARLY Alpha. This game is going to be worked on for AT LEAST the next 10 years. The developers love the IP. They are super transparent and listen to the community, and you can see the progess of the game LIVE every Friday on their Twitch episodes (http://www.twitch.tv/40kcrusade). They explain what they're working on, what they've changed, what is a priority (full keybindings soon) and all of their hopes and dreams.

Right now in the game, your rig is going to need to be decent. If you check the forums, some awesome members have given guides how to tweek your game as to how to get some pretty decent FPS if you find it unplayable. It's all a matter of making some tweaks, as the graphic options in the game are basic default Unreal 4 engine settings, that don't do a whole lot...

As for the game itself, it's not yet the MMO you're looking for. It's a very early shooter, with minor Asymmetry balance. Random map rotations, and random attack/defense placings. Very barebones customization as far as loadouts are concerned, but much, MUCH more to come as customization (both in loadouts and visuals) are a top priority. You cannot yet really join with friends, other than a simple Steam option to jump into a friend's game, but even that is chancy. The studio is small and they are pushing as hard as they can to make the game you want, but it's going to take time.

Balance is constantly shifting. Melee used to be useless, and now can seem slightly overpowered. But there is a counter to everything. Don't expect one loadout to accomplish every single task, and switch loadouts to bring what your side needs more of in the battlefield. Don't get tunnel vision. That said, some loadouts are more versatile than others, and some are very narrowly focused (don't expect to snipe infantry with the Lascannon. This isn't Space Marine. Lascannon is anti-tank, and that's bout it.)

If you are willing to help test out an early game and help make it the game we all have been waiting for, then please participate. Everything is constantly changing as patching is regular, so nothing you hate will necessarily remain in the game, as it is nowhere near close to a final, polished product. But I'm having a blast, and I'd love more of you to join so I can melt your faces.

Early Access Review

Before I review this game I can not possibly stress enough that this game is in ALPHA!

PROS:
-Action is fun if unforgiving
-Team based
-Enjoy playing with friends/group
-Some good map and weapon designs so far

CONS:
-In much need of balancing, a few builds are very blatently OP
-Much development still needs to take place in terms of well everything from melee to factions
-No optimised as of yet

If you are an avid 40K fan who loves playing team based games then you may love this game and I'd strongly recommend it, however it does have many performance issues currently so if you aren't a 40K fan or can't put up with bugs and a lack of optimisation then I'd suggest waiting a bit until more content is added and the game stability has improved.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hi I'm the creator of the frag video on the store page. And I wasn't paid to do it!

I've been an active part of the Eternal Crusade community for years now and seen just about all there is to know. The game has gone through some turbulence prior to early Alpha in regards to plans for how the game will be built but the pieces have slowly been coming together since the first release of the game. Because of the evolving nature of an early access title It's hard to talk about all the fine details that are going in and out of the game but i can provide some info on the latest developments.

Just recently the max player count has doubled to 64 players and along with it came a fortress map. We've been getting quite a number of new weapons such as the multi-melta and power maul. New Eldar and Ork information/assets are being showed to us on a weekly basis. Eldar is scheduled to come out first then Orks.

So on to the question of whether you'd be enjoying early access or not. If you're a 40k fan who understands what an alpha and beta is then i would recommend to invest early. If neither apply to you then you'd be better off waiting.

The game is feature incomplete and not yet at the stage to be fully optimized or balanced. You'll need a decent machine to run the game well atm. There are currently some problems with AMD hardware. The Shooter part of the game is getting the most attention atm and the MMO stuff will come in later.

If you want to know anything about the game that can help you come to an educated decision to buy or not I'll answer any questions you may have. Shoot me a message on my profile page or interact with me directly on my channel which I stream EC on a weekdaily basis at twitch.tv/gloriousdjpenguin

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was an original founding member, and I really wanted this to be good.

But even if I thought I was playing an early test build for a sequel to Space Marine, I'd still be disappointed.

Clunky melee. Weird hit detection and latency issues. Awful, bouncy physics for vehicles. Ugly in about every measure. Clunky map traversal with the inability to run up many tiny little rocks, and arbitrary distinctions between what you can and can't vault. 3rd rate animations and effects. Tons of balance issues to work out. Mostly, though, this is the worst use of UE4 I've seen. Mean Greens feels like a AAA title by comparison, and I guarantee that wasn't in development for 2.5 years. I've not seen an alpha feel this broken in a while, maybe ever. In gameplay terms, EC makes Space Marine look like UT4.

And none of that even touches on the fact that this was supposed to be an MMO. But there are literally no MMO aspects yet. Just 16v16 right now. And I've never played an MMO alpha (rpg or otherwise) that has started out this incomplete. Half the factions, no pve, no xp or gear system. Just loadouts and shooting. In a poorly optimized engine. With some of the most sloppy melee and ranged combat. Escuseable for an MMO. Not so much for 32 player capture-and-hold.

Maybe it'll get better. But I don't think there's reason to have hope. They've done nothing but scale back their goals, and still deliver a sub-par product. Even for an mmo" alpha.

They're asking money for this garbage. Please don't give them more."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have about 254 hours played so I may be bias but I enjoy it for what it is with some hope for what it can but expect it to stay about the same. That said...

The game is a lobby third person shooter with a world map in development.

Melee combat is huge and knowing how to use the melee mechanics is one of the more difficult but rewarding things. Nothing like being a plain old Bolter Space Marine and fighting off a Mark of Nurgle Assault Marine with power axe while you are artfully slashing them with your knife.

Even then with the most mastery of those mechanics it is a big buggy but still manageable.

Shooting in the game is the standard affair for a third person shooter except you get crazy weaponry like melta guns, lascannons, plasma cannons, etc.

There is friendly fire so expect to die at least once per match to a caution to the wind plasma toting friendly who fires into combat recklessly to get their kill at the expense of your life.

They currently have a few maps, one of which is a cool fortress with a great setup where defenders have 300 lives and need to defend 2 objectives in 30 mins or before they lose 300 lives/tickets. The attackers have to breach the fortress gates OR sneak through tunnels to ninja cap the first objective before pushing onto the second objective in the inner fortress.
The rest of the maps are tug of war style or conquest style objective maps. All of these maps will be tied together for the larger war effort and each instance of a battle will count towards each factions control of those territories.

Right now we only have Loyalist Space Marines (LSM) and Chaos Space Marines(CSM) with a few differences in looks and some different classes by playstyle. Example the LSM have apothecaries that can carry bolters or a pistol and chainsword that can also heal players or instantly pop up downed players with their special ability in close range. While on CSM side they have aspiring sorcerers who can heal from a distance with psyker powers at the expense of their heal being more of a heal over time vs instant refill. There are a few other class differences like that but not much yet.

They do have a cash shop for vanity gear IIRC but its not implemented in game yet for testing. Also the servers are in Montreal so if you are not on this side of the planet your lag may be really rough just FYI.
They have 3 vehicles types Rhino (10 man Armored personnel carrier), Predator (5 person Battle Tank), Vindicator (Breaching fortress walls).

Overall if you pay the 39.99 and expect it to be pretty buggy as an alpha, don't expect open world, don't massive battles with hundreds/thousands of players and have some patience for balancing in progress with alot of strategies changing based around that then it really is a fun game as my 254 hours hint at least for me.

I've had alot of epic moments with random players by rallying a squad and counter charging enemies in a big mess of melee, or frantic last stands in the fortress with the team trying to survive the waves of enemies breaking through, or crazy cat and mouse fights with air assaults, or the times a buddy of mine both play air assault marines and coordinate flank a huge group of enemies throw frags at the edge of their group so they cluster then slam into them from the sky and unleash chainsword hell on them ...so many good times and the game hasn't even launched yet :D

If you do want to give it a go and want a clan and like my insane response here then check out http://battle-brothers.net
Oh and if any of you do buy the game and want to get some added perks like rogue trader points then feel free to use my referral code so we all get some points to abuse the Warhammer 40k Rule of Cool in game :)

Referral Code ---> EC-8HJOW3PWQFX91

If you guys have any questions let me know and my Steam name is [V-M] Krage as well I try to help new players as much as I can to make for a better community in my limited powers for good lol.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Update: Jun-05

Inital Consideration:
First off, this is a Steam Early Access review. What's on Founder's Servers is under NDA, and its for founders, not the regular player wondering if he should buy EA on Steam, though I am a founder and I have taken the progress on UAT in consideration, I'm not talking about it.
I'll be focusing on 2 aspects here:
1 - Playability in the current state.
2 - Project progress.
This review is for actual Steam EA players:

About Progress:
I'm following twitch every friday and I'm on the founders community since they launched the founder's pack, guess I bought my captain's pack apr-2015 if I recall correctly.
Still since I got access to this game (oct 2015) I have seen nothing of progress but some maps, weapons, voice acting, and ground assault (those were the most significant) delivered. Took them 9 months to get only that going.
Now whats still missing from the checklist until they deliver the launch version??
Lets see: http://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/375230/extras/Infographic_Steam_616px.jpg
Humm, you see my point?
Seriously, I hope with all my heart bE will deliver that version on 2016 (as promised), but by the pace shown so far, well, I would say they didn't get even 25% from the checklist done in these last 9 months and 2016 will end in less than 7 now...
It just doesn't seem likely.
But hey, have faith... I still have... some... a little...
Just not enogh to thumbs up this and not feel I'm deceiving myself.

About Playability and FPS:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This isn't a 'Yes' review so much as it is a 'Neutral' review.

Quick TL;DR -  Do not buy this game if you want something remotely well optimized, or completed as of the date of this review.  Wait and see a couple of months.  Buy the game if you have a beefy PC, really want a 40k TPS fix, or just want to support the developers.

This game has a lot of promise, and is pretty fun even in the barebone state of Alpha gameplay that it finds itself in.  However, I would hold off on buying this game due to multiple reasons.    First, some quick positives.

+Fun gameplay - think Battlefield/Battlefront meets 40k Space Marine
+Really brutal fights, especially in melee
+A ton of potential if the devs live up to their promises (which they seem to be smart about now and have tempered a lot of what was promised when the game was first released)
+Devs that are very talkative, communicate well with the playerbase and are open to suggestions
+Solid foundation of things to come

Now for the negatives, which is ultimately why I  even flip-flop on saying if this game is worth buying.

-Completely awful optimization.   This is one of their priorities but if you don't have a mid-high PC or better, you probably are not going to have a good time.  My PC isn't the best but it's certainly not low tier, and I feel like I'm playing in my old ♥♥♥ laptop when I play this game.    760 GTX, i5 4670k and 16 GB are quick specs for those interested.    This is also due in part to the game's engine, which is actually UE4, which is sort of new to my knowledge and has a lot of optimizations to work out.  However, the game is months from release, so hopefully it is ironed out soon.   If this is not fixed this could potentially be the game killer for a lot of people, as it was in another similar game Planetside 2.

-Barebones.  It's Early Access, and at the moment the game has three maps and two factions, with limited weapon selection and no customization or any of the MMORPG elements implemented.   This is soon to change, with many things upcoming and two other factions on the horizon, with one (the Eldar) being 'soon', which is more than likely 4-6 weeks as of the time of this writing.     Do not buy this game thinking you're going to get a remotely complete package.

-Balance issues.   This is actually relatively low on my list, but the game will need a lot of balanace tweaking and design changes if they want this game to be more competitive.   It's not awful at the moment, but once optimization is fixed the devs will hopefully begin to focus on making things interesting per class/faction.

-Optimization.   This one cannot be stressed enough.  It's awful.

So overall - a game with enorumous potential that's already fun despite almost no content and awful framerate stuff.    Buy it only if a super serious dedicated 40k fan, or if you want to support the developers.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Clearly this is an Early Access title, and it may, given time, have a bright future ahead of it...

...but right now, please, save your money.

I get the distinct impression that a lot of the positive reviews are coming from people who are very enthusastic about the 40K license. That's fine, but honestly, this is not 30-40 quids worth of title as yet. It just isn't.

More worryingly, is the fact that it plays horribly. I felt like I was playing a very poorly made console port. Not a PC game. Auto aim is a 'feature' of certain weapons, melee combat often comes down to 'I pressed attack first' = win. It's just a very clunky, plodding shooter - or at least that was my experience.

It's caused me to ask for my first ever Steam refund in 10 years of being on the platform.

Buyer beware.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't post many reviews, but here goes...
Considering this game is in alpha, and has a long, long way to go, it is excellent. At the moment you either play as marines or chaos rather than the variety of four armies. No perks for your characters yet, but you can see where they are going to put that in. Also there are only 3 maps, with very similar game types. Then again it is Alpha testing, and is pure chaotic fun. The game is less glitchy then most shooters out there in full mode.

If this really does sell on, it could be massive, more game modes, more armies added as dlc's (tau and nercothingys etc). I cant wait to see the tyranid part. They could even add to the current armies, terminators and dreadnoughts etc. Can really see huge potential.

I lost my interest in gw stuff long ago, but this brings pure joy, havent enjoyed a shootout this good since cod mw2. Bravo and keep up the good work! I look forward to seeing more and more of this :D

For now, I will enjoy killing a few heretics or fight for chaos :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's obviously a title for the future. As a Planetside 2 fan i think a 40k MMO Shooter will be spectacular to behold, something i've long wanted thus i'm happy to support this project through it's development.

But is it any good now? I think so. It's worth bearing in mind it will be a while before it enters it's MMO phase, it has more in common with battlefield crossed with Space Marine at the moment. It's very similar to space marine in fact, the controls are almost the same so if you liked that game, and more specifically it's multiplayer, you'll probably like this.

A lot of people are having issues performance but i havent (40-60fps even on max). And i dont consider my PC high end but upper mid range. I'm using an R9 280x (sapphire toxic) and have and i5 4590 (3.3ghz) and 16gb ddr3. But the gpu does get hot which i think is down to AMD cards and Unreal Engine 4 having a few unresolved issues at this point.

I was impressed with the netcode, considering i'm in Chile and the server is in Toronto Canada. It seems fine, it doesnt display ping but it feels like 150-200 ping and allows me to play competitively without being at a disadvantage.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm a massive 40k fan and have been following and supporting this from the start, sold into the founder stuff and everything, however...

In its current form I can't actually see myself playing it much more, I genuinely hope that things change with it. I really really want to like this game, for me I was hoping for a tighter more stable version of Space Marine Multiplayer crossed with open world Planetside 2.

It doesn't feel responsive enough to be on par with similar fps games, feels far too clunky, I understand that this is still Alpha, but you get a feel for games even in the early stages of development whether this is going to be a slick, responsive system.

I know that for alot of people they probably won't care about this part, but it really doesn't have the Grim Dark feel to it, the level design is too blocky, to me it doesn't feel like a natural landscape, let alone battlefield of the 41st millenium. Sure there is Gothic style architecture, but it almost has a stylised comic book feel to it at present.

There are lots of things that just aren't quite right, but they still kind of have the potential to change, one thing that stands out to me though, (it will sound stupid)

When sprinting, why does it look like that they are comical knuckle dragging orangutans, with the bounding strides, with the legs so far apart when doing so.

But anyway, in its current form, I don't recommend, but really really want that to change - If they feel that it is well enough along to be given Early access, I hope they update frequently otherwise I fear the worst.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

FIRST OF ALL, RIGHT NOW THE GAME IS IN ALPHA AND USING AN ARENA TEAM VS TEAM SETUP DESIGNED PURELY FOR GAME MECHANICS TESTING AND TWEAKING.

Now on to my review.
Taking under consideration the above statement, this is a pretty good game (for an alpha).
It is nowhere near complete, or what it is supposed to be (an open world MMO) when released but still a really solid start.

Does this game have issues? Absolutely! And alot of them actually! I am not going to say HEY ITS ALPHA HUR DUR" (although it is :P) but I am going to say that this is a product in development that we get to 'test" and experience as it grows to become something we all want! A good 40k MMO.

The Dev team has been open to the founders community and very transparent with their developement process with newsletters
date:
a weekly twitch show and an active appearance on the forums.
Patches have been released every one or two weeks depending the scale of content added (sometimes 3 weeks but we got massive patches and engine updates with them).

The part of the game we can play right now (16 vs 16 Domination style maps) is a good experience when you play alone but a Great Tactical one when with a group of people. This is a tactical third person shooter mmorpg after all

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Updated review coming soon. Devs are pumping out updates faster than I can review them. Reworked melee system, Diet Eldar, more weapons.

As of 1/26/2016 in its current state I can't recommend Eternal Crusade despite my own wishes to promote it, although I'm sure this will be a fantastic game on release, this is a review for the current situations and issues with the game, without talking about roadmap or in development features.

Eternal Crusade is an 16 v 16 third person shooter/hack and slash based on the Warhammer 40k universe using Unreal 4 engine. The current and only game modes as of its early access and this review release are conquest with a rotation of 3 maps. Players can play similar two factions, the Space Marines and Chaos Marines, which each have several classes which in turn also have limited customizable loadouts based on a point system, as well as 2 unique classes per faction. Eternal Crusade atm of this review features two vehicles, a Rhino transport APC that a squad can spawn out of and carries a resupply crate, and a Predator tank. Eternal Crusade also has an incomplete/flawed above average melee combat system, with a health bar and a regenerating armor (health buffer) bar.

I'm sad to say but the current alpha state of the game is plagued by bugs, performance issues, gameplay/balance issues, and hit detection issues. The rule of thumb being you charge for it, you're ready for an honest review of all the problems, note that I'll try to be unbiased despite my love for the future of EC.

Full review:
http://steamcommunity.com/app/375230/discussions/0/451851477890417514/

http://steamcommunity.com/app/375230/discussions/0/405691491110169053/

Its a very enjoyable game. A good chunk of complaints (not all) are entirely based upon people not nowing how to properly play.

A good chunk of people have no map awareness at all. on one map you attack a massive fortress. my character snuck ALL the way around got to the very top of the fortress and proceeded to snipe all of my enemies FROM THEIR OWN BASE. But how does this relate to all those other complaints?" well so many people complain about melee being OP
recommended: melee is not nearly as op when against someone who actual watches their surroundings. too often you can take a somewhat circuitous route and then pop up right next to four enemy units. you kill them one by one and their allies don't even know the person next to them is dying.  Even beyond that a good chunk of people respond to a melee attacker by pulling out their combat knife and trying to fight. What you should do is this :SEE your enemy
hoursPlayed: STOP what you're doing
voteText: and  SHOOT the living daylights out of them. i've been in some very melee heavy games and you can tell who the experienced players are because a good chunk of them switch to flamethrowers and proceed to mow melee characters down by the dozens. LITERALLY DOZENS. While melee is very strong right now and should be tweaked i am tired of finding someone clearly looking down their scope without a care in the world
helpfulPercent: killing them with a chainsword
votesHelpful:
just to hear them go on all chat "HURR DURR I keep dying to melee nerf it plox"

Now then i recommend it because i have mind numbing fun most times when i open the game. I have yet to have an issue of one side always winning because the consensus online is LSM are the best and yet i win upwards of 75% of the time on CSM.

Now then everything should be taken with a big ol grain of salt because this game is currently in EXTREME developement. It is extremely bare bones with not too much customization available. However
votesTotal:
their goals(which seem very achievable) already show how they will be taking the current low customization game into a MUCH higher customization game. as of right now they even have a massive equipment screen just most equipments are null due to not being fully implemented.

The really only bad thing i have with this game is it's computer requirements. I assume its because this game will be coming out in the future that they are gearing it towards the median PC when it comes out fully. as of right now you do need a powerful computer to run it on the highest settings with all visual effects. I saved up my money for a long time to get the computer I have now but i still remember when i only had my low end computer. DO NOT GET THIS GAME if your computer does not fit the recommended settings. otherwise you will most likely be put in a situation where you get constant lag to the point of the game being unplayable.

All in all i love this game and am really looking forward to its future developement."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

::Pos::
-It's warhammer 40k.
-Plays similarly to Space marine, but will have more features.
-Will get larger and larger scale as game goes on.
-Will have vast amount of customization to armor and weapons.

::Cons::
-Currently(2/2/16) very poorly optimized for all GPUs.
-Chaos Marines have an overwhelming advantage with two capturing classes, one being melee.
-Defenders have an extreme advantage on all maps.
-Spawn killing is pretty common.

In alpha, if you are a die hard 40k fan, I give it a 7.5/10
If you are NOT a fanboy, 5/10. Has a ways to go, but is definitely promising. The developers are very invested in the community and are trying very hard to push out updates. I have faith in them.

Try to keep in mind that in two weeks, many of the Cons could be fixed. This is an alpha after all.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Lemme just simplifiy this down into a reasons not to buy guide for you before I get onto the review proper.

Weak - Mid tier PC? Don't buy it now.
AMD? Don't buy it now.
Expecting good performance? Don't buy it now.
Expecting good balance? Don't buy it now.
Expecting a lot of content? Don't buy it now.
Joining friends a lot/lobbies? Don't buy it now.

Note I said, not now. It's good as a game. Really damn good but it's also an Alpha so those things up there have to wait. Combat is good, plenty of weight, balanced pretty well when you have a dry spell of content and they take focus on a balanced play patch, ranged is some of the best I've had the pleasure of playing, melee is improving and when it works it really does come together.

The community is genuinely one of the better ones I've had the pleasure with playing with and the devs are pretty responsive and have built up a good rapport with the playerbase. The weekly Friday Twitch shows they host are a good insight into what's coming next and it gives you a good chance to get your question answered in a much more open manner (people tend to be more complete when vocally discussing something I've found).

There's not a lot to talk about but this is where EC starts to build up traction and start moving faster in terms of development now they have most of the core systems in place. Eldar, Orks, Nids and more are still to come and can only add to the experience.

In short would I say buy it now? Yes and no. You already know why not and I'll be honest in saying to most players, just wait for beta/release. That's the experience you want. Alpha testing is just that, testing. They've set up a play environment but honestly, it's not what you're looking for right now if play is your interest. However if this hasn't deterred you and you understand the risks, go for it, have fun and enjoy the gameplay, just mind the bugs and I don't mean the tryanids.

(AMD owners take note, this is an engine issue and they can't fix it, ♥♥♥♥♥ at Epic and not at bE.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As other reviews have done, I'll point out that this Early Access is still the Alpha stage of the game. There are issues, both with performance and balance. There is also a learning curve, which you need to take in to account when you review the game or play for the first time, so that you can help distinguish between a real issue, a pet-peeve that you feel needs addressing, or just a lack of experience. The game has come along in huge leaps and bounds since the beginning of last year even, with both huge improvements and some setbacks. So again, the game is still in Alpha, but it can and will only get better, so put your faith in it like all us other Founders.

As to the game itself, it's alot of fun. Even in 16v16 lobby setup the matches are intense and can often come down to the last few minutes capturing or defending points. Teamwork is essential, and although sometimes you'll be able to get some good victories with your teammates just going for the same objectives and sticking to the basics, you'll find the game a whole lot more fun and easier when you work well with a team, using the in-game comms rose, messaging or chating. Always be ready to adapt to any situation, be it swapping class to take a point or take out vehicle, mow down masses of enemies or leap into the middle of them and slaughter your way free. And remember that all classes can stop a point capture and to watch your friendly fire!

the idea had huge  potential, but it is now a totally different game than announced.

Kickstarter campaign was about open world, PVE, progress trees, tactical elements, huge scale.

But the game itself is just about melee-clickspamming and zergs. Only two of the five announced factions exist (4 were announced to be playable). And both are roughly similiar except on melee class turning the whole balance awry.

Yes, it is alpha and I have high hopes the other parts will be added in some point in time but in the current state I would not consider buying/funding it again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

THIS IS STILL IN ALPHA!

ALPHA

That being said, I do believe it is a really good alpha and has a lot of potential. I joined the Eternal Crusade as a founder in the later portion of the Closed Alpha (Warrior pack). I have played through a lot of different patches and have seen a lot of different features that were added and are still being tweaked. It still has a long way to go, but I am confident in BI that they will get it done.

Being a big fan of Warhammer 40K I can say that this does feel like a 40k game. Currently there are Space Marines and Chaos marine factions, with Elder on its way and Orks later this year. There are several sub factions for each faction with more to come.
Weapons include the Bolter, Plasma Gun, Plasma Cannon, Heavy Bolter, Las Cannon, Storm Bolter, Chainswords, Power Axe, Force Sword, and Power Fist to name a few. They also currently have Predator tanks and Rhino transports.

I usually play ranged and feel that the ranged combat is really good. Close combat is tough and really fast but they are still tweaking it. Balancing is still happening and they still have a few features they need to add.

I have a pretty good Rig and so Eternal Crusade plays really fast and clear (I haven't checked FPS). There are a lot of people that have problems with it graphically (Be careful AMD users). This game is NOT optimized yet, again it being an ALPHA. If you don't think your computer can handle it, WAIT for either the Beta or for when it fully launches.

Pros:
-Really good combat, fast, brutal, unforgiving
-Maps are designed well for what we have so far
-Teamwork (join a guild or play with friends)
-More to Come

Cons:
-Still need to balance things
-Teamwork (Lonewolf is discouraged)
-Not Optimized yet (This will happen in Beta)
-More to Come

9/10 Rating

Early Access Review

Constant framerate below 20, i changed config user file to low grafic quality according to tips on the warhammer40k eternal crusade forum, but that did not help. My pc fullfills the minimum specification and should be more then enough to play this. It is unplayable for me, unable to aim proberly at enemies or following the action. The 3rd person perspetive is not helping at all. I can't see what is going on on the left side of my character, so people can not only sneak at me from behind but from the left side too. Never had that problem of a blindspot in a mp game before. field of view is too narrow for a 3rd person perspective. You get 4 character slots, 2 factions, a handfull of weapon customization. That feels like very limited content for a multiplayer shooter without singleplayer campaign. Asking nearly fullprice release is a little bit too much for this. For excample Space Marine TM had a singleplayer campaign and multiplayer on top of it for nearly the same price.

I am really disappointed, i would have loved to play a good multiplayer shooter in the warhammer 40k universe without the restrictions of the peer to peer mp in Space Marines.

I know that this game is in early access, it could be better in the future but in it's current state it is not worth for me.

Have a nice day

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Word Bearers were bunkered down at the capture point, 5 maybe 6 were in there. Firing their Bolters out into my advancing brothers, 2 went down straight away, the new guy his head gone, the veteran took 2 in the chest and was bleeding out.

But I couldnt stop, storm shield raised I ran head first into the bolter and Las cannon fire, the cannon blasting through the Battleship plating on my shield.  4 of my brothers behind me plus the Land Raider, its Storm Bolters and Main Cannon showering the Herectics with holy fire.

I was the first in, on the right the Night Lord looked suprised to see me, the wings and sword on my shoulder signifying me as a Dark Angel was the last thing he saw, as I plunged my powersword through his chest, leaving him on the floor, blood pouring out I ran to his friend. The Word Bearer had an axe of his own, we collide like the gods of old as if it was the Emperor facing of against his traitor son Horus. The thunderous clashes of metal filled the monolith as axe met shield, I took the hits as my brothers moved behind him, he lasted 4 seconds as his back was rained with bolters, he fell at my feet as I finished him off by removing his head from the rest of him.

I fell, a las cannon struck my shield from afar, sending me through the air.
The Land Raider tank made very quick work of him as he exposed himself taking me out, the apothocary was on me straight away, Injecting me with painkillers and adrenaline, i ignored the pain and got back on my feet. My squad was already taking the center console in the monolith, but the enemy were advancing. Two Land Raiders were blasting  eachother ourside, realising we were on our own I waited next to the entrance, the power in my sword pulsating eager for Heretic blood. They came.

The Black Legion traitor ran past, with 2 more quickly following. They fired at my brothers, but they held firm, 1 went down, taking a lucky bolter shell to the head. I advanced. Slicing the first traitor from back to sterm, quickly I moved to the second Legionaire, he turned to me and fired. My Astartes power armour doing its job, trust in the god emperor and the tech priest of mars for making this power armour I sliced him from shoulder to shoulder. As my brothere were fending off and advance from the other side, the leader face me, his raptor jet pack flared and he flew at me with his chainsword.

The teeth on his chainsword ate at my shield, my sword swinging to try and catch him off guard, suddenly he flew up in the air, aimed at me, and scream towards me, i raised my sword to meet him. Piercing him through the eyes he was lying across the floor from me, I took his chainsword straight in the chest and was bleeding out, I wasnt going to make it. My squad still holding the Monolith were receiving reinforcments.

But I knew I would be back, to rain the Emperors vengance on these Heretics, Aliens and Mutants.

The Emperor Protects.
