reviewText:
Early Access Review

So the game has some issues, but it has great potential.  Graphics are so so, but I expect improvement as the game goes on.

Gameplay is fun but if you are not a fan of 40kI doubt you will play much of the early access. Aiming your guns is clunky.  This game does better with a console controller than keyboard and mouse right now.  Executions look cool and are right at home in this universe.  Hiding behind walls and cover is an unexpected feature.

It has a lot of potential to be good.  Battles feel large, and games go on longer than you would expect.  Vehicles add a lot of variety to gameplay.  The races are mirrors right now but as space marines and chaos marines are the only races currently, that's not very unusual..  You create faction specific characters so I am curious to see how the eldar and orks turn out.

This game needs unlocks, or perks or battle streaks, or all three.  Still fun but incomplete in current state.  Still recommended to fans.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's very much Early Access at this point, and very alpha. So don't expect something complete or polished here.

But from what I've seen, I like it. It has potential. It feels like the developers looked at the good elements from Relic's Space Marine and expanded upon them and put them into larger-scale warfare. Compared to Space Marine's small, laggy arena matches (which I loved, granted), we now get LARGE, laggy warzone matches. Lascannons and krak grenades serve a real purpose, as there are turrets, vehicles, and other hard targets in addition to the Tacticals, Assaults, and Devastators running around. On top of that, they've added more classes to the 3 from Space Marine, such as the Apothecary. Healing seems to be a new concept, with wounded battle-brothers crawling around on the ground in search of a revive.

In short, it's Space Marine 2: Planetside. If the developers keep up the good work and polish what's in place (it's in dire need of both performance optimization and network optimization), they're going to have a real winner on their hands. Just don't jump into it now if you don't want to play around with a janky alpha build.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is not an Action title. It's an RPG, there's no doubt in my mind. I started playing this game like a shooter. Run, run, shoot, melee, shoot, reload, die, etc. Then I realized the error of my ways. reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am a huge WH40K fan and among a sea of mediocre titles this really shines. Considering this is still early alpha, I already had lots of fun with it. The combat feel visceral and powerful, ranged vs melee is being constantly balanced in order to make them viable.

The game still has performance issues, bugs of course and at the moment only Space Marines and Chaos Space Marines, with Eldar coming soon and Orks further down the road. Basic loadout system has just been implemented and there is no progression. Also, it aims at being an open world Planetside 2 like game however for now we have 3 maps to play with. What is amazing is how the game already feels very WH40k, capturing its spirit.

It's quite amazing to see it grow and every patch brings in new content however this is still very early stage. If you like FPS and WH40K, go for it. Otherwise, consider waiting a bit till the Beta phase when more features, optimisation and races have been added.

If you are looking for a mature Space Marine clan/community to join, please take a few minutes to hear what I have to offer for you.

It is in this Chapter that their hopes of ever regaining their lost honour lies. If not, the stains of their tainted honour will be washed clean with blood upon their death, as they die in service to the Emperor.

So we are more like a prison" chapter where Astartes are seeking redemption.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is early access, so this game is far, far from done. They're planning to do a lot but as the game stands now, it is a fun, simple third person shooter with classes.

1. You only have 2 races at the moment, chaos and space marines.
2. The combat is intuitive and easy and satisfying.
3. If you are joining early access and expecting a full game, you are wrong.


At this stage, this game is a fun 3rd person shooter that deserves props for starting by getting the combat right. It is a long way away from its promised destination but it is fun to play. Unless you want to support the developers, I would wait til the game fully comes out to buy. I'm enjoying this game right now and look forward to watching them continue forward and upward!
voteText: 14 of 26 people (54%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's pretty good as an alpha. Graphics are choppy and unoptimized (to be expected in it's current state). Gameplay is fast, furious, and gritty in the spirit of StarSiege: Tribes, Unreal Tournament and Gears of War. But like it's spiritual predecessor: Warhammer 40K Space Marine, the movement feels like you're playing a paper cut-out model than a 1 ton space marine in armor. I know that sounds funny but, if you remember playing any of the original Gears of War games, not only was it gritty but, movement and physics made you actually feel like your character had some physical weight to it. I don't know how they would go about fixing something like that but it definitely needs some polish and optimization. But overall, I am most certain this game has potential to blossom into something gorgeous and real; something worthy of the Warhammer 40k IP.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far: worth it for 40k fans, absolutely. Actually if you're a 40k fan, you WILL end up getting this. It's that fun ALREADY! :D Okay maybe not, but I love it.
It only has 3 maps, but theres 120+ planned, which is why I feel that if you dont want it now, youll en up wanting it later. Get it when its cheap.
It has Eldar, Chaos, Space Marines and Orks, but only Space Marines and Chaos Marines are available at the time of this review.

Not a  40k fan? You should wait. Although Eternal Crusade is immensly fun for myself and many others, dont let an alpha be your first 40k game. Try Space Marine, or Dawn of War II first.


To be more specific on details: It's matched based PVP, but very tactical. Each class doesnt seem all too different from the next, but after a minutes you'll realize each is very distinct. So far the community is stellar, and a lot of people respond to squad tactics from the selection of commands we're given.

Like I said, 3 map, but 120+ planned. Stuff like wall breaches and giant 40k siege tanks are planned, because some of those 120 maps are fortesses that require full on warfare.

Early Access Review

Now despite my positive review i am NOT recommending you purchase this game, right now. Having followed the game for the past 3 years, I can safely say this game is going places, the game devolpers are 100% transparent, the good stuff, the bad stuff, and the bug stuff.  And it's fully funded, so no EA nightmares here.

What i am recommending with my review is to put this game on your WISHLIST. Ive seen the growth of the game, and it's very promising. it's horribly un-optimized, and half of the races are not in the game yet. However the core of the game is VERY solid, and is only being more refined. And the systems being set in place for the game are looking only brighter with every passing dev-stream.

Tl;Dr Good base game, poorly optimized. Recommend for your wishlist and follow the games devolpment. You will not be disapointed.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI have many years playing shooters and beta and alpha tested alot of them I went into this game with a open mind. My current review of this game is as follows. I your getting this game as a shooter, DON'T .Right now there is no way I would call this game a shooter. I would call this a melee game with some shooting elements thrown in. The guns are 89% useless in a fight, it's all the melee classes that rule this game. The melee classes can kill anyone from 1 to 3 hits no matter what you do , and keep in mind that these are not slow attacks either if you see a melee chances are you will be dead in a max 3 seconds. Most of the time it will only be 1 second. Why don't you shoot them at range you ask? you can try to do that but thats where the guns really show how useless they are. The guns just don't have the power to take out a melee class from medium to close range. Right now you can empty almost half a clip into them and they will be on top of you before you can kill them. One of the biggest problems is that when they swing their weapon they leap forward, not little distance but a stupidly large distance, pluse they have a sprint. Most will just sprint up to you and kill you and the 3 other guys that are with you before deading if your lucky enought to hit him. From what i have seen most people playing the assult class don't even use the jump pack they just sprint everywhere, you don't get much jump time with it, you don't get enough time in the air to line up a attack so your better off just running on the ground. You will not get too many kills trying to shoot people, ALL the top scores are done by playing the melee classes. whats stupid right now is all the capture points are indoors in small areas that just make the melee class even most powerfull. Till they do something to balance the melee and the guns in the game I would not recommend this game, it simply isn't fun if your getting it as a shooter becuase it falls way to short at being one. If you like melee combat then maybe this game might be your cup of tea. I didn't like the melee on melee combat myself I thought is was like taking two action figures and bashing them against each other till one of them broke. My final thoughts on thisn game is that if they are calling it a shooter then that should be number one in the core gameplay, to market it as a shooter right now feels more like a big fat lie and a ripoff I would not recommend this game, and I am not going to bother to try this game again till they fix the shooting aspect of the game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I wish there was more than just Yes or No when recommending this game.

First off, I've been following this game since the day it was announced. My forum account is dated October 13 2013, the first day you could register for the forums/website. So it's safe to say I have been invested and following this game.

Long term goals of the game have already been discussed to death and back. We all know they plan to have 4 factions (Space Marines, CSM, Eldar and Orks) along with the possiblity of more after 'launch'. We all know they plan to add vehicles for the factions and hero units. We all know they plan to use the open world system of Planetside. We all know there will be PvE Co-op content with Tyranids. Etc.

The thing is these are long term goals. I mean LONG term. There is no telling when any of these things will even be on the horizon. We have yet to see anything about Orks, matter of fact I've heard from people that the whole Free 2 Waaagh thing has been scrapped. The main devs that hyped such things have since left or moved from the team. We saw a small glimmer of our fabulous rhinestone encrusted God-♥♥♥♥ed-Into-Existance Elfs on a dev stream. The only discussion about the Planetside system was a video from a year ago being discussed by devs that are no longer on the team. No one knows when or if the open world system will be implimented. We saw a small video of the Tyranid PvE Co-op content. Basically people running from Tyranids.

The game at its current state is basically a Space Marine clone with a server, more people, classes, vehicles and less customization and less optimzation. It's a X versus X lobby TPS team shooter capture the objectives etc. A basic barebones form of the game. If I had to give it a name, I'd call it a Poor Man's Space Marine at this current state. Of couse this is the point, they want to test and make stuff now so they can slowly impliment it into the actual product they promised. If the product they promised is still on the table. (COUGH COUGH SURVARIUM)

Unless you're a big giant Warhammer 40k nerd/fan...I would suggest holding off and waiting. OR just buy it now and sit on it. That's my plan. I bought a Founder pack on like the last day of the sales because I caved in to my crippling Warhammer autism.

I have hopes for the game. I have a desire to see it succeed. I'm sure you'll get entertainment out it but just remember the promised product is a year or two away.

IF the game change in  the next months to something even playable and with at least HALF the promised features, i would recommend it, but for now this game suffer from the 40k license curse of lackluster games.

Dont forget, only even try if you own something like a GTX 960 or better.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATE: With the recent patches, the game has become a lot more playable for me now, still some lag but it's a lot more manageable now.

I've been playing this every now and then (since the alpha release for the Warriors Founders Pack) to see if there has been any improvement on gameplay.
This game for me is still impossible to play because of either lag or the choppiness, because of that I'm not playing this as much as I would like to. Although not as bad as when I first played, but I still can't keep my aim on the target, enemies teleporting in front of me and dying before I even released what happened.

If you plan on getting this, be prepared to get screwed over if your faction starts on the lower side of a certain map, you'd be put in a complete disadvantage from the get go. The maps are good, but this one inparticular map has one faction completely over towering the opposing faction on the lower side with only 3 paths to advance on, all 3 of which is exposed in the open to gunfire and suppression: main road for the tank(s) and 2 lifts on either side. The other problem with this map is gaining access to the capture points, again the top faction will have an easier time getting to them.

Assault marines, assault marines as far as the eye can see. Pretty much from what I've played, Assault marines > every other class. Melee weapons hits really hard making you flinch plus the stun from the landing impact = guaranteed kill. A simple fix would be to make the Jump Pack more vulnerable to gunfire, thus increasing your chances to shoot them out the air.

Graphics option needs to have proper settings rather than a slide meter or at the very least a custom option so you can at least tinker around with it.

Despite what has been said, I'm still interested to see the end product of this game, I do think that'd be an enjoyable game, especially given that the WH40K Space Marine online multiplayer is dead, this would be ideal replacement.
Hopefully, we'll see some unit customisation too.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let`s get some things out of the picture.

The game is poorly otimised at the moment.
It is in Early Alpha on Early Access, so expect the game to butchered for many things
Barely anything that isn`t connected to the gun-play is implemented.
Now with that out of the picture, listen to me for a moment.

Eternal Crusade got the ambitions to one day become maybe the 40k game we have always had wet dreams about. You and your battle-brothers (or chaos brethren, you ♥♥♥♥ing heretic) will fight side by side to accomplish an objective, in the grim glory that we have read about for almost 25 years. While the game is bare bones compared to what you have been told, take into consideration to visit the forums to the game. These developers are some of the most transparent you can find in the industry, knowing very well what is wrong with the game and what we, as the community wants (terminators bby gimme dem sexi tactical dreadnoughts~~~~). Do not lose hope because the game is in a poor state now, because this is all part of the devlopers` plans.

Buy this game not for the immediate satisfaction of shredding your enemy in a hail of bullets, but for that we one day, may get the game us 40k losers have always dreamt of, an Eternal Crusade.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe game is at its alpha version and has a long way to go but its on that way. Its maps so far are very well and strategic and its combat of many opposing squads requires good coordination among squad members and squads themselves. The game now doesnt lag at all to me and i have an old cpu - amd phenom IIx4 - so there is nothing to hold people back from getting it now as there wont be lag. I can enjoy this game so much already and i dont usualy play shooters, i play rts cause i like rts and thats why i am good at rts and bad at shooter cause i dont like shooters much BUT in this game made me play good !!!!!!!!!!!!!! As its alpha no premade full teams are in availiable the official way yet but you can join a game a friend is in so you can play more than a squad with friends as when the game starts it takes time to fill at early so premade teams are possible this way. So if some friends want a good team game this is a game to play. Also dungeons of pve will be included for this game as its gonna be an mmo rpg shooter but these will come later closer to release i assume not any time soon which is great, a group of tanks, transports and troops going to attack the tyranid hives !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! SO GREAT !!!!!!!!!!!!! I play this game mostly with people i meet in games cause my friends and i dont have the best timing yet to play and most people i met there and played are ok to cooperate, its not the same as playing with your friends you know in real life but still we cooperated pretty good. I am really enjoying this game from its current stage and i am kinda impatient for its main release.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A fun 40k themed blend of Gears of War and Battlefront; with the eventual release to be akin to Planetside's faction PvP system. The gameplay is solid and each class has their own strengths and weaknesses. You also have dozens of people roleplaying in-game; if you love to hear dodgy Ork and Chaos impressions this is the game for you.

That being said it's in ALPHA currently so the game is a constant lagfest, audio goes crazy during firefights, vehicles flip from colliding with everything and there is no current progression system in the game. With all the difficulties the devs have had the basic gameplay is fun and that is what is focused on in the alpha; shooting and smashing stuff. Don't buy this game if you expect a lot out of it currently, do buy it if you want to test it out and support / follow the devs in their progress.

Ultramarines suck
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

February 11th 2016 review:

For early access it plays and works how you expect it to, albeit with some framerate issues and some obvious balancing that needs changing. Fact is, if you're buying this game right now you're buying into the fact it's still in alpha and you should expect as such.

Saying that, the gameplay is fast and furious. Guns sound menacing and Space Marines / Chaos run around with a satisfying clunk (they are, afterall, wearing armour that weighs a ton!).

Cons?

There will always be cons to early access. The game is nowhere near finished at the moment and as stated above, there are definitely balancing and performance issues. It's also 16v16 right now, instead of the persistent planetary war that is going to be in the final release. Saying that, it works well for now!

Conclusion:

If you like 40k and don't mind performance issues then buy it. It's a decent game in it's own right already (albeit a bit repetitive since there aren't many maps). It will only get better from now and I anticipate the game will cost more money once it's finally released. There are already many ways to fit your loadouts and several of the most popular chapters available for both Chaos and Space Marines and the combat feels quite refined even at this early stage.

NOTE: I will update this review when more significant updates are available.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Right now in Alpha the game  already feels pretty solid. All the core components of the game are fun and once they're finished and polished will be the ingredients for a game of the year contender.

Gunplay and Melee combat are constantly being tweaked to find that perfect balance, but overall the core systems work great. Shooting mechanics allow you to take cover, roll out of the way of grenades or incoming melee troops, and even in Alpha there are plenty of guns that all have a purpose. No one weapon is more powerful than the other. Melee troops are devastating versus ranged combatants and have a solid system of quick, charged, and defensive attacks to handle fighting other melee fighters.

Visually the game has a great art direction but the optimization isn't there. Low frame rates and a lack of technical 'wow' are the current gripes, but what we have right now is functional to say the least and will only get better with time. The audio is great with all the sounds of carnage you would expect from a Warhammer 40k title.

The game is updated pretty frequently. The amount of content playble right now is small, but it will continue to grow once the mechanics are perfected. The game is currently just a death match style shooter but will expand into an open world later in development. Full character customization and RPG style progression is also planned.

I will continue to update my review of this game throughout Alpha. I give it my reccomendation currently to those who are fans of Warhammer 40k. To everyone else, put this game on your radar and watch it like a hawk. Only dive in if you wish to give developer feedback.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As it is: A fun functional third person action multiplayer. It lacks optimization and a lot of polish at this point as well as content.

As a proof of concept and actual early access this is great, this is how it should be done.

There's not much else to say really if you want to chip in and ride along as this develops and don't mind some fps drops/lack of variety in maps/teams at this point I can easily reccomend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you liked the combat of Space Marine then you're gonna wanna check this one out.

The potential for this game is clear. I'm really excited for them to get the Orkz and Tau into the servers so we can see something new.

Right now it plays more like BF with 32 players in large maps trying to capture points. The huge difference is it definitely feels like space marines fighting heretics from the movement to the executions to the voice acting. Much of this seems to have been borrowed from Space Marine, but I have no issue with that. The cool addition has to be the predator tanks and rhinos. You can already see the foundations of something cool here.

The maps could be more balanced, but I think theyre just there to playtest anyway. You really should be buying this to test the classes (a few more than Space Marine) and the mechanics as well as to get on the train early for what seems to be a really great project.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me just point out that I am a die hard Warhammer 40,000 fan. I have been playing W40K table top since I was young, I also play Dark Heresy and continuously play all relatable W40K video games. So my review might be skewed slightly due to the fact that I am already a huge fan. This is also my Early Access Review, so it may be subject to change.

Pros
Fantastic Combat System
Atmospheric/Visually aspiring to the 40K environments
2 current playable classes. Eventually 4, with one AI controlled class
Great Developer/Community Support
Works moderately well with Steam Link/Steam Controller
Cons
Loads of Bugs, but it's in Alpha
Audio issues
Alpha Review Score: 8.2/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

! PLEASE ! do realize that if you buy this game, it is still in a early stage, do not expect a completed game when you buy it.


I bought a founders pack back in November, and I do not regret it. The developers are by far the most transperent and friendly I have ever seen ( Nathan <3).  Weekly twitch shows to talk about what they implement into the game, weekly updates to the game etc. They are also very friendly towards the community.

Although the development of this game has had its problems (switching company etc) , the development has come a big way since then. Nathan really helped get the game on track to be made.


There will be bugs, alot of the features that will be in the game are not there yet, there are currently only Space Marines and Chaos Space Marines avaible to play, there are no Tyranids in the game currently. The massive large open maps that were talked about before is not there yet.

But by buying and playing ,you can sleep well knowing that you contribute to one (the most?) epic WH40K game that will ever see the daylight on Steam.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game crashes a lot–nevertheless I'm liking the game, thus far. I haven't played a lot, so my opinion may change over time, and I will update the review to reflect that.

I'm not a huge shooter fan, nor am I a big Eternal Crusade fan–I bought into the game because of how unique the concept is, and because of what it may become. To my delight, however, I found myself enjoying the shooter component of the game.

Performance issues, limited graphics options, unbalanced gameplay, crashes, and lack of features are all something you should take into consideration before buying, of course, though I'm fairly certain you will not regret purchasing Eternal Crusade.
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Open Alpha

So coming to Steam has benefited  me personally as I seem to get a lot more games than I did on Closed Alpha.

I highly recommend watching Zoran the Bear's video review on the store page as he explains quite accurately  and clearly where the alpha is at and the footage is gameplay.

If you loved and still play W40k Spacemarine then at some point you will be getting this game, although at this point it has limited content but  even in it's current state you find it as much fun action play as you could currently with  W40k Spacemarine and probably more variety as you have 5 classes to choose to play.

This is a strong alpha version and it is mindblowing that is alpha when I play it, the final product will be so good.

So $40US currently to  get in and I think it is worth it even at this stage, the bugs don't seem to interfere too much but graphics are not optimised and this weight can be felt depending on your connection latency and video hardware you are using.

I spent over 2500 hours so far on W40k Spacemarine and having not even broken 5hrs yet  on Eternal Crusade I already know I am going end up spending more time on this gane.

I will review my review as development stages progress.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a great base of a game. Currently its a 16v16 lobby based 3rd person shooter.

It has solid mechanics, good graphics and a great feel. For me it is running seemlessly on max settings even while i stream it.

It is also early access. Its alpha. Please dont come into this expecting a finished game, you will be disapointed! But if you simply cannot wait to get your hands on a game that really makes you feel like a bada** space marine stomping your foes into dust then grab it now, its only going to get better, thanks mostly to a great dev team who honestly listen and care what their players think.

If your not ready to part with your cash on such an early access game i suggest you add it to wishlist, keep an eye on it and drop by some of the streams from time to time to see how its progressing.


TL:DR
Fun beautiful and bada** BUT early access so unoptimised/unbalanced/not full content

Early Access Review

This is a game with a lot of potential, and I have high hopes for it, that being said, understand that when they say 'alpha early access' they don't mean it's a demo like some dev's do. Understand the difference.

The game is currently in early stages with some placeholder assets and bugs, and the scope is currently in small multiplayer point capture matches while they nail the combat down, but like I said, I feel the game has a huge amount of potential, it's unreal 4 and optimization is done last so if you're on a toaser, maybe wait until the later stages.

Early Access Review

I see tremendous amounts of potential in this, however I cannot underline the fact more that this is FAR from a complete game as of now.

There are factions, weapons, vehicles and a great many things missing. Battles are also only 16 v 16 right now.

NEVERTHELESS if you are a big fan of the 40k Universe (and also like teamshooters) this game is definately worth a look.
The developers are working hard and are releasing updates and fixes on a constant rate.

If 40k is not really your thing, I'd recommend waiting for a bit and monitoring this games progress.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First thing, this game is still in alpha, so don't buy the game expecting it to be completed then come here a whine about it in reviews.

That being said, I highly recommend this game. I can rattle off a ton of really nerdy reasons why I love this game for lovingly recreating my favorite fictional" universe in excellent detail

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly? Im pretty new to the game, but slowly getting better, takes some practice.
Chaos Space Marines win most of the matches, but its because they have two capture classes, and it seems, more aggressive players.
Chaos Raptors WILL kill you.  They WILL.
Once you master the Assault Marine and Raptor Classes though, they can be definite death in the open.
Some things dont look textured, but I really dont care. A) Its in Alpha, B) The game is ♥♥♥♥ing awesome otherwise.  I also saw on the site the Imperial Fists will be arriving after the Space Wolves.
Want to be a devastator who uses a Plasma Gun as a mortar?
Want to actually try and breach a Fortress that is actually built like a fortress?
Look no further.
I think the Fortress like nature of the maps, and the disadvantage of the Attackers on the Fortress Maps is good. Increases the challenge and makes it fun.
I am excited to fight against Orks and as Eldar.
The Devs are awesome, they care about legitimate feedback.
Aiming is a little odd sometimes, but you'll get used to it.  Cover works funny sometimes too, but Im sure all will be fixed eventually.  Sometimes the Elevators just pass through you.

Bottom line: IT IS WORTH THE MONEY.  It is worth your time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Warhammer 40,000 : Eternal Crusade[www.eternalcrusade.com]
This game was my first venture into the realm of Warhammer. In it's current state it is a 20+ vs. 20+ battle arena with vehicles. There are currently 5 classes per race, with their own weapons/fighting styles, you can switch in game on death. Each race gets one heal/support class and one class that can capture objectives. Only 1 class per race can capture or interrupt captures.

The Rogue Trader Store is down, but you recieve currency with the purchase.  Here is a cache history of the previous items[web.archive.org] from when there was an NDA. If these are any indication of the future then you will be able to buy vehicles, weapon skins and Hero class characters.

The leveling system is there, not sure what it's for at this state besides a Steam achievment. Very little weapon variation, a lot of little missing stuff but overall it is playable and enjoyable. I run at 24 fps, which while low, this game is not optimized yet, it's an Alpha, that's a Beta thing to do.

If this was even remotely helpful in your purchase decision  please consider using my recruiter code : EC-IZ2JNA6DJAOUI[www.eternalcrusade.com]

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhen I was a young man, couched over my 40k miniatures fretting over camoflage patterns and painting eyes and other assorted details I wondered to myself Can Games Workshop finally turn this into a video game already?" Well they did. And it's called Dawn of War. But if you want that whole grimdark wild
recommended: Eternal Crusdade will definitely hit the spot. Basically I would call this 3rd Person light Shmup with it's fast paced matches and brutal 40k-ish combat. Not satisfied that the Chaos Space Marine will get to bleed out after you filled him with the Emperor's Holy Bolter Fire? Introduce that gentleman to a chainsword with a bleed-out execution. It's a nice touch that sort of captures that madcap violence that we've come to know and love from the Warhammer 40K universe. However this is not without a couple reservations; this game is most definitely in early access. It's a little rough around the edges and in some cases players can't play it due to optimization issues. I never had this problem but I did notice a few framerate hiccups that went below 30 FPS. I'm no expert but I would say on my rig (which I would call "mid-range" with a 750ti gfx card) I was getting 20-30 FPS on average. This game has a little while to go before it's fully optimized. Also quite a few features are missing and the matches are awful small but from what I understand that is being worked on. The missing stuff isn't bothering me too much but I am rather excited to play as Saim-Hann Eldar when they're finally released.\n\nTL;DR If you're a 40K fan
hoursPlayed: don't even hesitate to buy it. If you don't have a decent computer to keep pace with the action

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been playing for abit now and have a good understanding of the game / mechanics.

I'm enjoying the game. Its pretty awesome to jump into a Warhammer Tactical shooter...but its seriously not a shooter. It's a melee - extravaganza.

I can literally go Jump-Assault with a Power Sword and get 15 to 20 kills with 5 - 10 deaths. Not shoot 1 time. I love the idea and understand that melee is a huge part of Warhammer, but no one should be able to fly around and destroy 3-4 people mashing thier face on the mousepad.

I am making it a point to stay Tactical and use a Regular Bolter. I put 4 rounds (headshots) into someone, but yet they can close the gap... and kill me with a Axe / Sword / Powerfist in 1 to 2 swing. Its making it tough to keep playing.

UPDATE: Great melee change. Please boost the dps to Bolters just abit. Make Plasma non spammable. Add a way for new players to see who is and is NOT on your team. Im tired of Defending and because I get a Dbl red arrow on me, a new player unloads on me.

Overall, I know its Alpha... I am having fun. The goods outweigh the bads atm, but thats because I understand the game. Melee to win.

Now that been said. This pre-alpha is amazing, I love the game and can't wait for it's next patch. The shooting mechanics are close to good now, granted the 3rd person camera is ♥♥♥♥. I whish it had a FPS screen but meeeeh, it is what it is.

Frames per second are pretty bad right now, I get around 50-55 at best, and on full combat it goes under 20 but the game is in diapers still and I'm confident the developers will deliver a properly polished game at launch.

I won't recommend to buy 'cause the game is pretty broken still and if your brain can't understand what an Alpha-build is, then you better stay away for a while.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Going to recommend this ever though there are a few issues which I will point out. Bear in mind that I'm recommending it based on the state the game is currently in, it's alpha access which means that everything isn't there yet. Due to their partnership with Bandai Namco I'm pretty sure this game will actually deliver into retail apart from many early access titles out there. So that should be taken into consideration when purchasing this game.

The gameplay is very solid and incredibly addictive and fun. I expect to sink a large amount of hours into this once progress becomes persistent but I'm holding on a bit for now since I already tried the mechanics that are actually out there. In it's core it is fairly similar to Space Marine, which is a very solid game as well. For me personally, the Space Marine multiplayer is better, mainly due to the reason that you're not as squishy, which you are in Eternal Crusade. This is something that I believe has to be remedied in the final version. Space Marines should not be this squishy, I feel like a soldier in battlefield. This is really my only problem right now in the game. If this gets solved and gameplay thus becomes slightly slower this will be an amazing game. I can't really delve into any of the promised features since I haven't tried them yet but I'd advice any potential buyer to go check out the website and see what the devs are up to. This is one of the most interesting Warhammer projects out there right now!

I can't wait to start sinking tons of hours into this once progress becomes persistent.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The early access version of this is just combat. Similar to space marine online but with a battlefield squad system and battlefront esque classes,  the base game is very fun and well built and the devs are in close communication with the players on the website's forums. Developers don't often listen like these guys do and it's a real treat. They want to truly be apart of the world they're building and you can sort of pick up they like the game a lot and really want to see it succeed.

Very actively updated and optimization keeps coming every week.  My FPS has gone up every update which is nice, and content is weekly rather than monthly. They plan on having the game released officially in the summer.

The 50$ price tag is the base game plus some points for the rogue trader market (in game cosmetic currency that will come out soon)

All in all, if you've ever wanted to jetpack onto the front line of a war for humanity with a chainsaw sword and a blaster to rid the universe of xeno filth, this game may be for you.

If you download it use this referal code and you get some extra points for the store, so you might be able to get wings or a servitor skull or something who knows. ;)

The game's really good and I would suggest it to anyone looking for a new game to get, Warhammer 40k fan or not. If you like TF2 (Team Fortress 2), then you'll like this game. The only issue that I think should be fixed is the balancing, diversity, and there should be armour: the Space Marines winning is uncommon and the classes stay the same when you rank up; the classes should get new weapons, maybe more health, and new armour. Also the races should have more variety. The game is very good for an early access game, though. The game is really fun and I would suggest anyone looking for a new game to play to buy this game.

Also just one race I think should definitely be added is the Tyranids. I'm imagining that there would be the Tyranid gaurd which would basically be like the Tyranid version of a Havoc Marine; there would be a  basic Tyranid that would be weak at ranged attacks but really good at melee; ranged Tyranid that would be good for ranged attacks, but not melee; and a medic type Tyranid that would basically be the Tyranid version of the Apothecary. There would be more classes than these four, but I'm only listing these because they're the only ones I've come across in any of the Warhammer 40K games.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To start things off, this game is early in development and it's poorly optimized. Even if you have the most powerful PC in the world you are not guaranteed good perfomance.

First, I want to say what Eternal Crusade is going to be when it's out.

Eternal Crusade will be an MMO shooter game set in Warhammer 40k universe. Closest comparison you can draw is Planetside 2, but EC is going to be different, mainly because of asymmetrical balance(each faction plays differently) and equal emphasis being put on melee and ranged combat.

However, this is what the game is going to be when it's actually finished. Right now, the game is in Alpha stage(and not the kind of marketing Alpha where you are sold a finished game). No, Eternal Crusade is in actual Alpha. What does it mean for you?
* While the end goal is to have large-scale battles, right now devs are balancing the combat system to make sure that core of the game works(in other words, the game isn't an MMO at the current stage)
* The game contains a lot of bugs and combat balance isn't the best(though it's better than it was when Alpha started).
* The game isn't optimized, so don't expect good perfomance even if you have powerful rig.
* Devs actually listen to what their community thinks, so you can actually influence the game's development.

Yet again, and I can't stress that enough - the game isn't finished and it will most likely have poor perfomance. In other words, if you aren't ready to play this game with 20 FPS, DO NOT BUY IT, because you will just get disappointed. Instead, follow the development of the game and hop in once the game is optimized enough.

Yes, I said about poor optimization three times already, but this is something that you absolutely need to know before you purchase this game.

Why is my review still positive? That is because while I will advice against buying it in the current state(unless you are fine with bugs and perfomance issues) this game still has a lot of potential. So I will definately advice you to keep an eye on it as it develops.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is my initial review of Eternal Crusade done on February 7th. Once more patches and features roll in I'll make sure to update it so it remains a good representation of Eternal Crusade's state.

Review:

Once finished, Eternal Crusade is going to be a large scale action MMO where four unique factions (Space Marines, Chaos, Eldar and Orks) vie for supremacy over a war-ravaged world.

However, as of right now Eternal Crusade is an objective based third person shooter very similar to the Battlefield franchise. It features only two out of the four factions (Space Marines and Chaos), a handful of maps and a bunch of interesting systems that are either unfinished or hampered by poor performance. But most noteworthy is the fact that its actually a lot of fun to play.

I was first drawn to the Warhammer 40k universe, many years back, on account of the extremely vivid and awesome battles other people kept telling me about. To my surprise, Eternal Crusade ended up being more than able to replicate those desparate and doomed battles against overwhelming enemies, acts of heroism and sheer stupidity that somehow end up saving the day and most importantly, all of those sounds that you would expect to hear from Bolter & Plasma fire.

While the battles are most certainly awesome the performance is unfortunately not. It can get so bad during large fights that you end up operating at sub 10 FPS which as far as shooters go is unacceptably low. I would be a lot more negative about the whole performance problem if I didn't have an entire day after a hotfix patch where everything worked as the Emperor demands. Issues sprung back up tomorrow but at least now I know they can be solved in the near future.

Despite the performance still requires a fair bit of work the actual gameplay of Eternal Crusade is rather well done for an early alpha. There are a variety of weapons to chose from across the five available classes, many of which are similar but unique enough to appeal to different players. Even though I've tried and enjoyed the ranged classes, the real highlight of Eternal Crusade to me is the melee system which is a bit ironic because I consider it to be quite bad right now.

It operates on a rock, paper, scissors system and while it sounds balanced on paper (heh) in actuallity most of your engagements will be decided in large part by the roll of the die. If you initially choose rock (heavy attack) and your opponent choses paper (light attack) you're just going to end up dead without much to offer in resistance.

It really is a shame since the melee combat in Eternal Crusade makes you feel like an actual badass Space Marine that can charge enemy lines (ideally from the back) and cleave through enemies in an orgy of death and destruction. However, these complaints might be short lived as the next big patch is set to bring a complete rework of the melee system.

Since not every situation is favorable towards melee playstyles I did also spend a good chunk of time playing around with the ranged classes, especially the default and boring" Tactical Marine. The kill times are generally low enough that through skillful play
date: good aim and ideally ambush tactics you can bring down multiple unaware opponents before going down yourself. Now I'm not sure whether this was on account of the server lag
recommended: my performance issues or me simply being bad but I found the spray control to be rather challenging
hoursPlayed: especially with the rapid-firing Devastator class.\n\nGiven that we are
voteText: after all

You can either kill the medic and ensure the steady stream of healing stops

** Verdict **

Eternal Crusade is nowhere near its lofty MMO goals but the objective based shooter on offer right now is pretty good and even though I've spent the majority of my playtime under 30FPS I can't say with a straight face I didn't have fun. It is very much so unfinished and unpolished so if that's something that bothers you then I recommend you simply wait a few months

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great fun and True to the game rules and lore.

The game is pretty fast paced and best when played as a squad with friends. If you head in without thinking you will die in mere seconds. There are enough classes-weapon combinations to adapt to any situation and more are coming.

The developers really understand the 40K universe and constantly update and patch the game. They are in contact with their player base and do weekly twitch shows etc to let people know how the development is going and what the plans are.

Keep in mind that this is still an early access game and still has alot of thing to improve on (But still fun) and they are actually being improved on instead of just being promised.

If this game was developed by a big company they would release the game and charge dlc for the ekstra stuff devs are giving us.

So tldr: Blood for the Blood God

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, this game is still in the Alpha stages of the game. As such we are still testing out the core mechanics, I.E. combat. There is still balancing and optimization to do. That being said, if you are having fps issues with the game PLEASE take the time to visit the forums. There are a few helpful posts that point out some ways to get better performance out of the game.

That being said, so far the game to me is very enjoyable for what it is. This is by far one of the best experiences I have had with a game still in development. The devs are VERY transparent about what is going on in the development of the game. We are constanlty updated via the forums, and weekly twitch streams. They also are very good about listening to the input of the players.

If you are looking at buying the game I recommend looking up youtube videos and twitch streams. Also come into it knowing this game will still be changing alot throughout the development. There is still a lot to be added. You also may not have the best performance right now due to issues with the UE4 engine. Like I said though, there are posts in the forums to help out with this issue. All in all, if you can understand that this game is still in Alpha and has not had its optimization yet then I highly recommend it. I have 140+ hours on record and a Captains pack for founders and I do not regret my decision to buy at all. Cheers Brothers, and see you on the battlefield!!!

Early Access Review

Please note that Im not the best at explaining this in words when reading this I hope it helps though. I would Recommend this game.  Eternal Crusade heavily relies on skill, teamwork, communication, tactics, and much more. This also applys to PvE elements of this game form what the Devs have show in there live streams. I have spent many hours on this game since Frist Wave, and have loved it, if they keep on track this game will turn out to be amazing.

One big thing to remember is that the state of this game is an ALPHA state, so there going to be some rough areas on it, like for example optimization, however it is slowly geting better. Still if you have a PC setup with Nvidia GTX 970 or higher you will not struggle as much in the FPS (Frame Rates Per Sec) as sadly an AMD GPU (Video Card) user at this time will struggle more so in the FPS (Frame Rate Per Sec) area. Also they are running the Unreal Engine 4, its a very new Engine and is also being work on to fine tune it, so it has it quirks too. So keep this in mind when if you do pick up this game.

Any help the devs can get when it comes down to Feedback on fiding things in the game and breaking it so to speak will help improve this game even more. They have a long road ahead of them and alot of work, I can say that I have seen the hard work that goes into what they have done so far. They are seeking a wider net of players to join in to help improve the game, keep this in mind as well. Also, never hurts to read up or do reserch ont he game as well before you deside to get involved as well.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nGreat groundwork being laid for what will hopefully be an awesome game. Understand that the game is still in Alpha and Early Access. Understand there are no in game tutorials and there is a very steep learning curve. If you understand that then by all means purchase access to Alpha test this game. date:
you're purchasing the ability to test a game that's being developed.

The Devs are very much in touch with the community and community feedback is shaping how we play and fight.

There's a great mix of melee and ranged combat. Understand up front that in the 40K universe melee is just as prevalent as ranged combat. Melee will NOT just be a minor annoyance ranged players have to deal with occasionally. Melee combat is ever present(yes you can melee with your ranged classes) so learn melee mechanics early on or have a miserable gaming experience.

Big picture type stuff isn't in yet. You get to test maps and test builds right now in a match based system.  The combat is more enjoyable than many of the finished shooters on the market

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Has some real potential, but definitely requires work, melee combat system is complex to get the hang of and most matches will leave you with a positive score in the 20's or 30's simply by spam melee into groups, range is only really an option at exceptional distance in order to avoid the cluster♥♥♥♥ that is close combat, with so many effects and flashes taking place at once it's near impossible to tell who's who in a close firefight, resulting in huge amounts of friendly fire, which is horribly unforgiving, and trying to walk anywhere but inside a structure or tight alley results in you being run down by the multitude of tankers, since ramming is far more effective. All in all, give it some time, see where things go, hopefully at a later date i'll be able to recommend this game.

EDIT 15/02/2016
I probably should have prefaced previously by saying if you're a big fan of the WH40K world get the game, you will enjoy it, but if you're new to the scene I would give it time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Keeping in mind this is an early access game, I am going to review it in it's current state rather than it's end product, actually this will be more like general comments on the game.

The game itselfplays really well, there are squads which are basically players in a team, you wont really play with them as a team unless you know them personally, but other than spawning from a rhino I am sure this function will have a bigger part to play later on. The game plays really well and there are frequent updates, this is early access so we are basically all testers for the game, so what that means is that there are currently 2 factions and it is generally capturing and defending so far wtihout any overaching objectives other than capturing and maintaining points.

Alot of love and care has been put into the game, and while it is still enjoyable the game has just recently been put into early access so there is alot of work to be done, but as mentioned earlier the game is enjoyable.

Now a personal note from me and if anyone would like to comment on this sure as I am not sure how wide spread the issue is and if it is wide spread then I will tell people to hold off for a bit. The problem I run into is that my display driver crashes which crashes the entire game and I have to exit out, giving me roughly 5 mins of game time or less, this happens sporadically and sometimes I can play an entire game, but more often than not it affects me. I would like to know from developers or the player base if this is a natural occurance that will be fixed, or if it is just me as this is the only game I have played where I have run into this issue. If this is wide spread, then once again I would recommend to hold off for a bit as this is definately game breaking. But giving the benefit of the doubt and it is just me then I whole heartedly recommend this game and enjoy it as it evolves over time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I just want to express a little of my excitement about this game. If you are intrested in a real review, then go look out for them, because the comments here offer quite a few good ones.

I'm just really liking Warhammer and I think, that this game has hella' much potential. When they made a few steps back from the open world/ mmo concept, I still was kinda conserened, that it could turn into rubbish, like a lot of early acces games did. But though they have a fixed date for release already and are updating things more then once per week, I really acquired my faith back.

Also the game itself feels a lot like Warhammer and is quite some fun already, because the meele concept and the jetpack thing are just awesome and with the other races there are so much more insane and fresh concepts to follow.
The community is really active aswell and you can for sure express the nerd in yourself with those people, which is a fine aspect, because the game is made so much upon the actual board game, that it probably can bring together computer and roleplaying nerds (I'm using this term in a posetive way here, because you can just enjoy youre time so well witht these things).

I cannot say, how the final result of this will be, but my hopes are high and i'm also willing to support the people making this game, because they present themselfs in a cool way and give us a lot of points to attach that hope to. And nevertheless they have persons like Graham McNeil, who just represent the Warhammer feeling through and through.

And since i always wanted to write something like this at the end of one of my posts:
For the Emperor and may his glory enlighten us all! And may all his foes kneel down and bleed before us (which includes the producers of this game if they ♥♥♥ it up ... they are probably awere of this; so this is another pro ;D)!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly, the game feels really good and it is very promising - heretics, brothers, bolters and plasma guns!
At the moment there are only 2 factions available - Space Marines / Chaos Marines. I am really looking forward to see the Orks and Eldars kick in.

I am really enjoying playing this and beHaviour (studio) is releasing a lot of updates. Kudos guys, keep it up! There has been a lot of improvement on the performance / optimization already since the STEAM release date.

However:

- Game is far from being a finished / polished title
- LAG is real and really impacts the experience in the most annoying way (I suspect no EU server yet) / for a shooter it's a killer point
- Current maps that are available are OK but simple capture'n'hold - honestly, I do not particularily like them and I think they need crucial level design revamp in some aspects / I really hope some better stuff is coming up
- Mellee fight (+lag) is imba and you just die most of the time not being able to do anything when attacked by preds/assaults (stun locks)
- Friendly fire is 1/3 of your deaths
- Vehicles needs polish and maps designed to use them at their full potential
- No real retention mechanic implemented yet except a shallow leveling system (with close to no bonus)

All in all, I would recommend this game to any W40K fan with some money to chip in. It is kind of an investment on the future and the future looks good thanks to new production initiatives and strategy as well as co-publishing with Bandai-Namco. For now, I'd say there is like 20% of the content available so looking forward to the next updates and developers that are behind their game 100%.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Here's why I bought this game, and why I recommend you buy it too:

Value.

Right now I'm paying 40 dollars for an alpha to what will eventually be a 60 dollar AAA game. The game even in its alpha stage is fun, maybe 10-30 hours for the average working adult. But what am I really getting?

I'm paying 40 dollars to test functionality, to suggest things to developers and help oversee this process. My 40 dollars buys me months and months of entertainment as new features slowly get added.

This isn't some indie studio trying to gank you for funds, where you buy and download a turd. This game is being backed by big names, and the proof is in the pudding.

The game is fun, looks greats, and matchmaking is fast.  Standard class-shooter, but remarkable for an alpha. And on thursday (2 days from date of this review) they are overhauling AMD functionality plus some other goodies.

TL;DR
Buy this game for 40 dollars now, get months of entertainment, test new features, ♥♥♥♥♥ to devs if it ain't right. have fun. Or else you'll pay 60 later for 30 hours.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclaimer : My experience comes from a short time of about 10 hours in the early access and this game is also constantly changing and balancing due to its alpha state , I will remake this review when it enters beta.

These are my impressions of the game and one should look into videos of the gameplay and multiple perspectives to see if they themselves may or may not like this game...


Eternal crusade is a Third person shooter ( that will change into a MMO that plays much like planetside 2 ) , the gameplay feels like Gears of war and space marine with a bit faster  Time to Kill " and larger scale combat with objectives like battlefield.

currently the races in the game are Space marines and chaos space marines both sides have some unique differences that can be deployed onto the field of battle.

Space marines currently consist of these classes:

1st: Tactical : the tactical is the basic marine that can be versitile and fill different roles as are needed allowing a constant and much needed for that can adapt to a veriety of situations..

2nd: Devistators : these marines carry the heavy weapons of the space marines from the awe-inspiring Heavy bolter that can suppress and dominate a small area when set up
date: to the fire power of a plasma cannon able to clear a room with a well places charge ( or blow up your friends if the user isnt so lucky ).\n\n3rd: Assault marines: These marines carry melee weapons and jump packs allowing them to cover vast amounts of terrain in short amounts of time to get up close and personal with their foes
recommended:
Assault marines should take note that due to their jump capabilities they shoulndt let their hubris take hold unless they want a heavy bolter to clip their wings. Be mindful of unwary chaos marines and strike them.

4th: we have the apothecary who is a medic that can assist his allies in battle.

5th: we have the storm shield class : Basically a tactica who uses melee weapons and has a shield to negate all damage from a direction until he is close and ready to strike.



Now onto the CHAOS space marines
hoursPlayed:
I will outline their difference classes here.

They do not have a class that uses a storm shield ( but this could change )

they have Tacticals
voteText:
Raptors ( with are Assault marines ).

The sorcerer: A chaos marine who utilizes the power of the warp to assist his allies or destroy his foes.

Nurgle marines : a space marine that is blessed by the mighty father Nurgle whom has bestowed this devote follower with extreme duribility allowing him to take massive amounts of damage ( I hope later these marines can spread diseases but thats whishful thinking :/ )

Later it is planed to release the orks and Eldar into the game.

Gameplay summery : The gameplay is a Third person shooter and each faction has distinct classes and loadouts that can turn the tide of battle allowing each faction to utilize their advantages efficiently without feeling OP.

Is it worth buying : I would say currently ... No becuase its ALPHA and many early access games dont really evolve from this stage
helpfulPercent: and the game has crap optimization ( currently there was a patch that tried to fix issues on AMd cards such as mine ( R9290x ) and failed
votesHelpful: I still get about 10 fps if im lucky ).\n\nBetween poor optimization and its current state I would say add this to a list and keep an eye on it
votesTotal:
If it really changes into the MMO it promises to become then YES buy it then and buy the crap out of it! currently just buy space marine for a more solid experience ( it still has a community as well ).



As a side note ( I HATE THE LASCANNON IN ETERNAL CRUSADE!!! ) It has a laser ointer thats a dead give-away to your location and lore wise THERE IS NO ********* LOCK NEEDED TO FIRE A LASCANNON... they did this for balance however and It still sucks at the one thing it was sopposed to be good for ( anti-tank )... just grab melta bombs or plasma weapons instead and avoid the Lascannon until its changed ( please change the lascannon ) - TASADAR101

However If you have a computer that can run this game I do recommened at least trying it out and if after an hour you dont like it refund it.

for now Im mixed with Eternal crusade

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game, even as an alpha, is absurdly fun to play. Movement feels heavy and powerful just like it should. The weapons sound Hardcore just like 40k should. Melee is satisfying and threatening despite ranged. The assault shield is flat out weak. The lascannon needs an overhaul. And when you play PLASMA you are stupidly overpowered.

Theres a bunch of things they're still working on - vehicle/non vehicle spaces for example that can be aggitating, but even then, this game is friggin worth it.

If you don't know what 40k is, the least I can tell you is that it is the most hardcore badass IP I've ever seen. And just about every single sci-fi IP in the past what 30yrs has been inspired by it.

None of the issues will stop from enjoying this game, and they do production updates every Friday via twitch and later port it to youtube.

Buy it - try it - steam has a grace period that allows you to return games you don't like.

This game is win. You feel like WIN while playing this game. Even losing is fun, because killing players is so absurdly fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have spent many hours (and money) reading books about space marines and when I heard about this game I couldn't wait for it and got into the founder program and it felts good. Yes, alpha, blablabla, bugs, blablabla, much time, blablabla,no MMO, blablabla, but it felt good to be able to play as one of the heroes of this awesome universe that is 40k and the game is still making progress. What shall I say about it ?

The main criticism (the others are, for me, more related to the early stage of developpement) I have seen about this game in matter of gameplay is about melee and therefore classes inbalances. Well what could we say about it ? This game is team objective focused, every class has to make its own part in order to achieve victory for the team. When the tacticals capture the objectives, the apothecaries /sorcerers heal their friends, the devastators/havoks defend positions and destroy vehicles and the assault, these crazy guys with huge swords and axes, they kill people. This what they are for, this is their purpose both in the 40k lore and in the game, so yes it can be hard for a tactical to kill an assault marine but this is the actual balance this game should have. Space marines and traitors are split into different classes in the lore of the 40k universe to answer different needs on the bloody battlefields of the far future, and in this game they do so as we could expect. Classes are not made to be even, this is not a battlefield or some game like that. Here the classes are made to be specialised, so yes this is not inbalance, this is specialisation.

However there are still progresses to be made, patches to be added, and if you want to play only as an Ork or an Eldar you should better wait. But if you love the warhammer 40k universe, if you want to play PvP game which less focused on who's the best player (the person who get's more time for gaming in is life while overs are working and having a social life) but on how can everyone best serve his team for victory and we lack games like that. So I'll be optimistic (for the money I spent) and say this game is going to be great. We waited long for a 40k like this one claims is going to be, let wait a bit longer but we have a good start here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To absolutely clear: THIS GAME IS NOWHERE NEAR FINISHED, OR AN MMO YET. With that in mind, let's discuss the game as it stands. First off I'd like to point out that the devs are fantastic. They are exceedingly transparent with the direction of the game and listen very closely to the fanbase (to not do so would be suicide, the 40k fanbase is hardcore beyond belief as it is rooted mainly in tabletop gaming).

Gameplay as it stands is a basic shooter with decent class customization and very unique mechanics, like the jump pack, executions, etc. etc. It's basically Space Marine with vehicles and an overall better feel. Combat feels heavy and impactful, very satisfying.

For those complaing about optimization, bear in mind this is an alpha. As the devs have stated, optimizing things at this point is not always the best course of action, as radical changes to the codebase might come along down the road. Even so, ninja patches DO help with optimization and a recent one brought up the performance a decent amount.

Overall, it's very enjoyable even as a simple run-and-gunner and will be amazing with the addition of MMO elements. I can't wait to see where this goes.

Early Access Review

This is a solid early access title and I say this because I am not experiencing any framerate drop or stuttering.
Its a ton of fun, as an apothecary, feeling the pressure to get your comrades up and running whilst under fire, it made my heart race numerous times.

The animations and the sounds are spot on, you can really feel the heavyness of the space marine armor when walking/running. Combat wise, it is also pretty well-made, you can roll, sprint, sprint tackle, crouch, crouch to cover.. etc.

The occasionnal lighting glitches, texture tearing on the ground.. Early access at its finest lol.
There is a lot coming for this game and the devs are doing a mighty fine job making the arena-style shooter solid while we wait for the mmo version with the RPG elements to be added.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There are many great reviews to check out, including Zoran's very in-depth video, so I'll keep mine to the point; these guys are not going to grab and run your early access investment. The development team is extremely transparent, with weekly twitch shows that everyone can tune in to in order to see what progress is being made with development. As a founder, I have found the development team extremely responsive to our feedback on the forums and on the electronic surveys they send out. Several things I have suggested myself have been implemented, and the development team are all active contributers of the game's forums. They answer our questions and settle our worries time and time again. The development team are not starved for funding and are not gambling with early access money. Enough funds have been planned out to see the core of the game released. All additional early access funds will allow for more content faster, but the core of the game is already certain. They have expanded their development team due to the extreme success they have been having since the founder's program went live back in October. This is a safe investment to make if you love 40k and you love large scale online games.

I would, however, advise everyone to proceed with care when purchasing, with regards to your personal expectations for what you might find after purchase. This game is in Alpha state (at the current time of writing). It is in it's development infancy and has only been playtested by players on live Alpha servers for a few months. There are frequently bugs and balance issues. At the moment the game is extremely hardware intensive, since it runs on the Unreal 4 engine which is undergoing updates and development its self. It is currently not an MMO and is only just beginning to introduct character progression that is currently non-permanent. Please understand that the game is not yet fit for judgement as what they are marketing it as. If you would prefer to wait to see more features in the game before purchasing, please do so.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I enjoy playing the game, im having fun. SM and CSM have a lot of similarities but also differences gameplaywise and mechanically. Nice features are the mix of melee and ranged, and the rapid movement with a jetpack.

Regarding the T2K, you can die really fast some times. Imo, thats part of the tactical/ strategical aspect of the game; dont walk into bad positions with the wrong gear and character for that situation. In other situations the t2k can be really long; melee feels short and ranged long.

Something that would be over the top, would be moving under ground, teleportation and playable Tyranids. Since the start ive followed this project, the progression is going steadily upward. Well see what EC has in store for us in the future, im holding my thumbs for this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I do recommend this game to people who are fully comfortable with buying an Alpha game and that are Warhammer 40k fans. To the general public, just be warned this is not the full game they are expecting at launch and theres a lot in development (like PVE and open world maps) that wont be in the game right now.

Right now, this game is a lobby shooter of 16v16 PVP matches on 3 maps which are like a capture the point kind of game. Only Chaos and Space Marines are in the game right now as the 2 factions. Watch some game play and video reviews of the game before buying it just so you get the full picture of what it is like.

Ive spent a LOT of hours playing this so far and I LOVE it, I daresay Im addicted :D Im very excited for when it does get to launch but if you are uncomfortable with the thought of playing an Alpha game, I wouldnt buy it right now but rather wait till either Beta or the Official Launch. If you are ok with buying into an ALPHA version of the game, make sure you know what you are buying (ie: new patches every week, bugs, class imbalance, FPS drops, lag) before clicking that buy button.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Here's why I bought this game, and why I recommend you buy it too:

Value.

Right now I'm paying 40 dollars for an alpha to what will eventually be a 60 dollar AAA game. The game even in its alpha stage is fun, maybe 10-30 hours for the average working adult. But what am I really getting?

I'm paying 40 dollars to test functionality, to suggest things to developers and help oversee this process. My 40 dollars buys me months and months of entertainment as new features slowly get added.

This isn't some indie studio trying to gank you for funds, where you buy and download a turd. This game is being backed by big names, and the proof is in the pudding.

The game is fun, looks greats, and matchmaking is fast.  Standard class-shooter, but remarkable for an alpha. And on thursday (2 days from date of this review) they are overhauling AMD functionality plus some other goodies.

TL;DR
Buy this game for 40 dollars now, get months of entertainment, test new features, ♥♥♥♥♥ to devs if it ain't right. have fun. Or else you'll pay 60 later for 30 hours.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To absolutely clear: THIS GAME IS NOWHERE NEAR FINISHED, OR AN MMO YET. With that in mind, let's discuss the game as it stands. First off I'd like to point out that the devs are fantastic. They are exceedingly transparent with the direction of the game and listen very closely to the fanbase (to not do so would be suicide, the 40k fanbase is hardcore beyond belief as it is rooted mainly in tabletop gaming).

Gameplay as it stands is a basic shooter with decent class customization and very unique mechanics, like the jump pack, executions, etc. etc. It's basically Space Marine with vehicles and an overall better feel. Combat feels heavy and impactful, very satisfying.

For those complaing about optimization, bear in mind this is an alpha. As the devs have stated, optimizing things at this point is not always the best course of action, as radical changes to the codebase might come along down the road. Even so, ninja patches DO help with optimization and a recent one brought up the performance a decent amount.

Overall, it's very enjoyable even as a simple run-and-gunner and will be amazing with the addition of MMO elements. I can't wait to see where this goes.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There are many great reviews to check out, including Zoran's very in-depth video, so I'll keep mine to the point; these guys are not going to grab and run your early access investment. The development team is extremely transparent, with weekly twitch shows that everyone can tune in to in order to see what progress is being made with development. As a founder, I have found the development team extremely responsive to our feedback on the forums and on the electronic surveys they send out. Several things I have suggested myself have been implemented, and the development team are all active contributers of the game's forums. They answer our questions and settle our worries time and time again. The development team are not starved for funding and are not gambling with early access money. Enough funds have been planned out to see the core of the game released. All additional early access funds will allow for more content faster, but the core of the game is already certain. They have expanded their development team due to the extreme success they have been having since the founder's program went live back in October. This is a safe investment to make if you love 40k and you love large scale online games.

I would, however, advise everyone to proceed with care when purchasing, with regards to your personal expectations for what you might find after purchase. This game is in Alpha state (at the current time of writing). It is in it's development infancy and has only been playtested by players on live Alpha servers for a few months. There are frequently bugs and balance issues. At the moment the game is extremely hardware intensive, since it runs on the Unreal 4 engine which is undergoing updates and development its self. It is currently not an MMO and is only just beginning to introduct character progression that is currently non-permanent. Please understand that the game is not yet fit for judgement as what they are marketing it as. If you would prefer to wait to see more features in the game before purchasing, please do so.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is fun. Even in Founders Access I've had more fun with this game than some major AAA shooter games. That alone makes it a worth while investment. With that out of the way I'd like to point out this is still in Early Access and a good number of features have not yet been integrated like Orkz and Eldar and Tyranids. The only thing you can customize at this point is loadouts, but that is going to change in the near future. Overall the game is simply fun. For $35 you get a good fun fps that you can sink hundreds of hours into while locking yourself in for the full experience that will be released in the near future. Great game, Amazing potential.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I enjoy playing the game, im having fun. SM and CSM have a lot of similarities but also differences gameplaywise and mechanically. Nice features are the mix of melee and ranged, and the rapid movement with a jetpack.

Regarding the T2K, you can die really fast some times. Imo, thats part of the tactical/ strategical aspect of the game; dont walk into bad positions with the wrong gear and character for that situation. In other situations the t2k can be really long; melee feels short and ranged long.

Something that would be over the top, would be moving under ground, teleportation and playable Tyranids. Since the start ive followed this project, the progression is going steadily upward. Well see what EC has in store for us in the future, im holding my thumbs for this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I do recommend this game to people who are fully comfortable with buying an Alpha game and that are Warhammer 40k fans. To the general public, just be warned this is not the full game they are expecting at launch and theres a lot in development (like PVE and open world maps) that wont be in the game right now.

Right now, this game is a lobby shooter of 16v16 PVP matches on 3 maps which are like a capture the point kind of game. Only Chaos and Space Marines are in the game right now as the 2 factions. Watch some game play and video reviews of the game before buying it just so you get the full picture of what it is like.

Ive spent a LOT of hours playing this so far and I LOVE it, I daresay Im addicted :D Im very excited for when it does get to launch but if you are uncomfortable with the thought of playing an Alpha game, I wouldnt buy it right now but rather wait till either Beta or the Official Launch. If you are ok with buying into an ALPHA version of the game, make sure you know what you are buying (ie: new patches every week, bugs, class imbalance, FPS drops, lag) before clicking that buy button.

That being said, I hope to see you on the battlefield! If you chose to join the Space Marines, welcome Brother! If not, I shall bathe in your filthy heretic blood! >:D
