reviewText:
Early Access Review

*takes a gulp of mjod* This one time while we were tasked with capturing some facility we almost broke a sweat fighting those traitors.

All went well until we reached point C, there we encountered a monster of a chaos predator tank that managed to stop our charge.

I witnessed as my battle brothers fell to the monstrous thing one after the other until I decided to do what any sensible Space Wolf would do. I put on my power glove and ran!

STRAIGHT AT IT!

And with a prayer to Russ I punched the tank hard enough that it got pushed off the top of the ramp it was positioned on, flipping in the air and landing on two traitors that were hiding behind some barricades.

Would tank volley ball in the name of Russ and the Allfather all over again.

On a more serious note, don't buy it unless you have a top notch PC.

Wait until it enters Beta and it is properly optimized, otherwise you're going to be stuck with 10-20 FPS.

Other than that? Looks promising.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclaimer : My experience comes from a short time of about 10 hours in the early access and this game is also constantly changing and balancing due to its alpha state , I will remake this review when it enters beta.

These are my impressions of the game and one should look into videos of the gameplay and multiple perspectives to see if they themselves may or may not like this game...


Eternal crusade is a Third person shooter ( that will change into a MMO that plays much like planetside 2 ) , the gameplay feels like Gears of war and space marine with a bit faster  Time to Kill " and larger scale combat with objectives like battlefield.

currently the races in the game are Space marines and chaos space marines both sides have some unique differences that can be deployed onto the field of battle.

Space marines currently consist of these classes:

1st: Tactical : the tactical is the basic marine that can be versitile and fill different roles as are needed allowing a constant and much needed for that can adapt to a veriety of situations..

2nd: Devistators : these marines carry the heavy weapons of the space marines from the awe-inspiring Heavy bolter that can suppress and dominate a small area when set up
date: to the fire power of a plasma cannon able to clear a room with a well places charge ( or blow up your friends if the user isnt so lucky ).\n\n3rd: Assault marines: These marines carry melee weapons and jump packs allowing them to cover vast amounts of terrain in short amounts of time to get up close and personal with their foes
recommended:
Assault marines should take note that due to their jump capabilities they shoulndt let their hubris take hold unless they want a heavy bolter to clip their wings. Be mindful of unwary chaos marines and strike them.

4th: we have the apothecary who is a medic that can assist his allies in battle.

5th: we have the storm shield class : Basically a tactica who uses melee weapons and has a shield to negate all damage from a direction until he is close and ready to strike.



Now onto the CHAOS space marines
hoursPlayed:
I will outline their difference classes here.

They do not have a class that uses a storm shield ( but this could change )

they have Tacticals
voteText:
Raptors ( with are Assault marines ).

The sorcerer: A chaos marine who utilizes the power of the warp to assist his allies or destroy his foes.

Nurgle marines : a space marine that is blessed by the mighty father Nurgle whom has bestowed this devote follower with extreme duribility allowing him to take massive amounts of damage ( I hope later these marines can spread diseases but thats whishful thinking :/ )

Later it is planed to release the orks and Eldar into the game.

Gameplay summery : The gameplay is a Third person shooter and each faction has distinct classes and loadouts that can turn the tide of battle allowing each faction to utilize their advantages efficiently without feeling OP.

Is it worth buying : I would say currently ... No becuase its ALPHA and many early access games dont really evolve from this stage
helpfulPercent: and the game has crap optimization ( currently there was a patch that tried to fix issues on AMd cards such as mine ( R9290x ) and failed
votesHelpful: I still get about 10 fps if im lucky ).\n\nBetween poor optimization and its current state I would say add this to a list and keep an eye on it
votesTotal:
If it really changes into the MMO it promises to become then YES buy it then and buy the crap out of it! currently just buy space marine for a more solid experience ( it still has a community as well ).



As a side note ( I HATE THE LASCANNON IN ETERNAL CRUSADE!!! ) It has a laser ointer thats a dead give-away to your location and lore wise THERE IS NO ********* LOCK NEEDED TO FIRE A LASCANNON... they did this for balance however and It still sucks at the one thing it was sopposed to be good for ( anti-tank )... just grab melta bombs or plasma weapons instead and avoid the Lascannon until its changed ( please change the lascannon ) - TASADAR101

However If you have a computer that can run this game I do recommened at least trying it out and if after an hour you dont like it refund it.

for now Im mixed with Eternal crusade

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt take a bit to get the feel of the game. Once you learn the flow and understand the how combat plays out this game will quickly become very addictive.  Right now it is a map shooter, but a very fun map shooter at that!  I have never ever had so much fun with a map shooter before.  Once they add the persistant world and RPG elements, I fear I may play this more than The Division (as long as WH40k:EC implements a truely open world where players can run into other players anywhere and not just in specificly designated areas.)  Warhammer 40,000 : Eternal Crusade is unfolding into the persistant wolrd RPG shooter that many have been craving for a very very long time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game, even as an alpha, is absurdly fun to play. Movement feels heavy and powerful just like it should. The weapons sound Hardcore just like 40k should. Melee is satisfying and threatening despite ranged. The assault shield is flat out weak. The lascannon needs an overhaul. And when you play PLASMA you are stupidly overpowered.

Theres a bunch of things they're still working on - vehicle/non vehicle spaces for example that can be aggitating, but even then, this game is friggin worth it.

If you don't know what 40k is, the least I can tell you is that it is the most hardcore badass IP I've ever seen. And just about every single sci-fi IP in the past what 30yrs has been inspired by it.

None of the issues will stop from enjoying this game, and they do production updates every Friday via twitch and later port it to youtube.

Buy it - try it - steam has a grace period that allows you to return games you don't like.

This game is win. You feel like WIN while playing this game. Even losing is fun, because killing players is so absurdly fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have spent many hours (and money) reading books about space marines and when I heard about this game I couldn't wait for it and got into the founder program and it felts good. Yes, alpha, blablabla, bugs, blablabla, much time, blablabla,no MMO, blablabla, but it felt good to be able to play as one of the heroes of this awesome universe that is 40k and the game is still making progress. What shall I say about it ?

The main criticism (the others are, for me, more related to the early stage of developpement) I have seen about this game in matter of gameplay is about melee and therefore classes inbalances. Well what could we say about it ? This game is team objective focused, every class has to make its own part in order to achieve victory for the team. When the tacticals capture the objectives, the apothecaries /sorcerers heal their friends, the devastators/havoks defend positions and destroy vehicles and the assault, these crazy guys with huge swords and axes, they kill people. This what they are for, this is their purpose both in the 40k lore and in the game, so yes it can be hard for a tactical to kill an assault marine but this is the actual balance this game should have. Space marines and traitors are split into different classes in the lore of the 40k universe to answer different needs on the bloody battlefields of the far future, and in this game they do so as we could expect. Classes are not made to be even, this is not a battlefield or some game like that. Here the classes are made to be specialised, so yes this is not inbalance, this is specialisation.

However there are still progresses to be made, patches to be added, and if you want to play only as an Ork or an Eldar you should better wait. But if you love the warhammer 40k universe, if you want to play PvP game which less focused on who's the best player (the person who get's more time for gaming in is life while overs are working and having a social life) but on how can everyone best serve his team for victory and we lack games like that. So I'll be optimistic (for the money I spent) and say this game is going to be great. We waited long for a 40k like this one claims is going to be, let wait a bit longer but we have a good start here.

For fans of big metal brawly men with big guns and even bigger tanks.

It is also exciting waiting for each weekly patch, developer livestream, updates and watching the game slowly improve and reach the potential that myself and so many people hope it can reach. reviewText:
Early Access Review

Although this game  is clearly still in Alpha, the quality and the fun is apparent.  Being able to rocket jump onto an opponent and slay them with a chainsword is pretty awesome.  This run and gun shooter is pretty familiar and solid, although I've found the cover system to be a little clunkier than other similar games.  The customization loadouts are in their infancy, but it still shows that they are really going to have a lot of options.  This game feels like your in a futuristic warzone, I really do have fun playing it.

All this being said, there are some real balance issues between weapons and the factions presented in the game.  Melee weapons are very, very strong.  A single character with a sword/axe can lay waste to a whole squad, negating the benefits of grouping together.  Apothecaries (healers) are practically useless since there are many one-burst kill weapons and the heal animation is painfully slow.  Vehicle combat is not quite clean yet (it feels like driving a rubix cube, I don't know how else to describe it).  Ultimately I would still suggest this game already, even though its in alpha you know it's only going to get better.  Fingers crossed, they add necrons or Imperial Guard in the future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly, the game feels really good and it is very promising - heretics, brothers, bolters and plasma guns!
At the moment there are only 2 factions available - Space Marines / Chaos Marines. I am really looking forward to see the Orks and Eldars kick in.

I am really enjoying playing this and beHaviour (studio) is releasing a lot of updates. Kudos guys, keep it up! There has been a lot of improvement on the performance / optimization already since the STEAM release date.

However:

- Game is far from being a finished / polished title
- LAG is real and really impacts the experience in the most annoying way (I suspect no EU server yet) / for a shooter it's a killer point
- Current maps that are available are OK but simple capture'n'hold - honestly, I do not particularily like them and I think they need crucial level design revamp in some aspects / I really hope some better stuff is coming up
- Mellee fight (+lag) is imba and you just die most of the time not being able to do anything when attacked by preds/assaults (stun locks)
- Friendly fire is 1/3 of your deaths
- Vehicles needs polish and maps designed to use them at their full potential
- No real retention mechanic implemented yet except a shallow leveling system (with close to no bonus)

All in all, I would recommend this game to any W40K fan with some money to chip in. It is kind of an investment on the future and the future looks good thanks to new production initiatives and strategy as well as co-publishing with Bandai-Namco. For now, I'd say there is like 20% of the content available so looking forward to the next updates and developers that are behind their game 100%.

With that out of the way, let me say that I've had a ton of fun with this game so far. Even in its current state as an alpha with only a handful of maps and modes, I keep coming back for more. By the way, I'm no scrub when it comes to online shooters, I've put hundreds of hours into the battlefield, halo, planetside 2 and cod.

Basically, EC is a third person MMO shooter. The game is focused on PvP, although there will be some PvE modes where players fight against the AI controlled Tyranid faction. So far the MMO" aspect isn't really there

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When i bought the game i couldn't even play it for 3 weeks (couldn't get 10 fps). SO i was realy dissapointed. But after that they made a nice optimization patch and now the game runs very smooth.

The game gets a patch every 2 weeks with visible changes and not just some minor tweaks and bug fixes. They also added the option of joining a friends game, which makes the game much more fun to play.

Ofcourse there are still bugs here and there (people becoming immortal and unable to move on the new map) but this is an early acces game, so things like that must be  expected.

This is not the first early access game i have bought, but it is definetly the best one i have. And you can also see the developers care for the games future in all the news that we get on the mail (i am founder don't know about others). So if you have friends who enjoy the warhammer universe you should definetly try it out. There nothing more enjoyable that executing a heretic by shoting him in the head with your fingers (a bug where you didn't pull out your pistol, but just shoot with your fingers, realy funny).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Generally I don't write reviews, as most of the games I pick up are ones I know i'll play and figure most people will anyway. The exception would be when the game has legitimate problems graphically, mechanically, or about the community. Unfortunately at the moment it's all three.

I cannot recommend the game in good faith. I've heard a lot of problems with AMD and the graphics, as well as optimazation being in a state of flux. It is an alpha afterall, so maybe when it goes into beta or full release this problem will go away.

Mechanically it's a fair bit off. Melee and the interplay between them and ranged forces are wonky at the best of times. Weapons clash with lore and function, and currently there's no reason for the bolters to exist unless you're skimping on points.

Worst of all though, the core reason no one should look into this game before full release and perhaps not even then. The forum management between Moderators and Developers. With 100% certainty if you're not playing the loyalist faction, you'll be neglected and abused. If something is too weak on your side, it's going to be low priority because Balance isn't here yet
date: it's alpha." but if loyalists have a problem that stuff gets patched within a week. The CSM side's sorcerer has had a near non-functioning weapon and all of its abilities are buggy so you're praying to Tzeentch it latches onto a target.\n\nOn the official forums
recommended: you'll have threads locked because one guy said something a mod didn't like. Hell
hoursPlayed: calling a dev out for making light of one faction's borderline useful class 'mark of nerfle' or passing the buck onto another dev then proceed to joke about the oncoming crap-storm will result in swift admonishment. If you dare suggest a dev should have some decorum
voteText:
you'll be silenced.

The mods and the devs devolve into petty threats and insults if you don't suck it up and play their horribly bugged game with a grin. The game itself may get better but these people will still be acting in the same distasteful way. I regret every penny but I hope the game can be at least a little fun.

long post short: the devs and mods are horrible people if you're not a Loyalist. pass on it."

THIS IS AN ALPHA

Even though this game is in alpha and is very multiplayer heavy, and as a person that loves single player gameplay I freaking love this. At first I was unsure spending that much on a unmade game and yes the first few games sucked but that is the same for ever game at first.
You're going to love this because it feels like you're part of the empire in a struggle for victory. The footsteps in your armor feel and look heavy, your guns feel like beasts when you fire them. I will say that the meele is over powered and so is that plasma gun but hey the game still has a lot to come. I would not recomend a sniper because the charge time you have to have the curser on the enemy takes way to long to charge up and fire, but it is a insta kill.
If you get use to the controls and find a game with your team mates in your squad stick together you'll have the best time in the world as you lead your team to victory. Something that wasn't properly explained was that when you want to capture a point you have to be the Tatical class" letting you know so you're not just standing there thinking you're captureing the point.

Side note. "T" is to taunt and you may thing "Eh who needs it" but when you hear someone press that you hear in the back ground "For the emperor!" as you all charge into battle
date: it adds to the gameplay so try pressing it every once in a while.\n\nThe only negative feed back I can give though my experiences are just a few glitches here and there
recommended: nothing game breaking of course. When it says create an account don't be turned off by it its just a little thing. There is friendly fire and you do get some teamates that will kill you for no reason and there is no kick option yet so be ready for that. If it gets bad just leave the game and join another. The game is early access so you mind find a hacker or two that insta kills you if  they see you

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As of May 10th I have owned this game for about 5 days. This isn't as much of a review as it is my experience so far in the 40 or so hours i have played.

First of all, the community for this game is wonderful. i checked out the videos on the store page and saw DJPenguin's frag video, i wanted to see more so i checked out his stream. Not knowing anything about the game he was very helpful with anything i wanted to know. As soon as i bought the game i was invited to come and play with him and his posse. From there i have met numerous excellent players, data collectors, admins, and have even chatted with some of the devs. All of the people I have talked to have been very informative and encouraging to me as a new player.

The gameplay obviously has lots of issues such as balancing, optimization, wierd UI bugs, eh netcode, etc. but i can overlook them because the game is in alpha and the devs seem to be very vigilant on trying to fix them and open to suggestions.

I would recommend this game to anyone that:

1. Likes 40k
2. Likes fast paced, stressful, team based games
3. Likes easy to play, hard to master type gameplay
4. Wants to see a game/community continuously grow

I would not recommend this game to anyone that:

1. Doesn't identify with things above
2. Can't deal with the buggy ever changing nature of early access

Perhaps i have had a pretty good start but i am definitely hooked and i really look forward to what this game will turn out like.

p.s. die loyalist scum

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So i've been following this game ever since it got announced waaay back in like 2014 or whatever it was. Is it living up to my expectations so far? Pretty much! I've seen it evolve and it's progress is doing particularly well.

Because there isnt too much to speak of since it's alpha i'll quickly list the good and bad

Pros
- Ranged combat is rather fun, likewise with melee combat
- Heavy emphasis on team play
- great to play with friends and clans
- Some interesting mechanics, such as the plasma gun
- VEHICLES AW YISS!

cons
- Balance is sort of a need right now
- Melee combat needs tuning (Devs are aware of this dw)
- Melee is kind of hard to both properly learn and master currently as well. Most people just end up spamming attacks until their opponent falls over
- Very little optimization, so if you lag like hell don't worry it's not you

Kind of inbetween
- The game is mostly currently dropping into instanced battles and having a gunfight, and by that i mean we still have a lot to wait for in terms of content.
- Graphics will be updated too later on so don't worry about that either

Early Access Review

NOTE: This game is in alpha stage. It is currently going through early testing and missing a lot of features.

I've learned about Eternal Crusade" few years back when a mysterious website came up with some awesome background music.
Since then we have past a long road
date:
people left and came but the overall vision is still the same - Massive scale mmo shooter set in the 40k universe.

About the game:Full introduction:   About Eternal Crusade click here[reibornxdax.blogspot.co.il].

In short Eternal crusade is taking third person shooter style of game (like Space Marine) and adding massive scale world conquest (bit like planetside) and while doing that adding many systems and other features.

Game is Buy2Play - > you purchase once and get full access to the game (all 4 races) and four character slots.
there will be free expansions and in the future paid expansions (like new races) will not gate you out of the game instead let's say they will ad new race then you can play against that race but playing AS that race will require a purchase.

There is sidegrades and decorative items store called "Rogue Trader"
recommended:
the currency for the store is "Rogue Trade Points" which you can get from referrals\purchase with money\in game activities.
All items in the store can be found in the game itself under different name\colors etc.
It's not P2W as best items and gear are only available via the game itself and not via the store.

Right now (January 26th 2016) we have alpha testing module with small battles of 16 VS 16 (Space marines and Chaos space Marines)
hoursPlayed:
when the game will be released there will be also Eldar and Orks.
Game is purely PVP based and the only PVE will be small dungeons of underground lairs with Tyranids controlled by the AI.

You can check my YouTube channel for gameplay videos: Reiborn xDAx

Should you get the game ?
If you can't stand alpha tests

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There's a lot to love about this game! It's been a priviledge to watch this game grow and the rate of progress in just a few short months has been incredible. The game gives you a great flavour of war in the Grim-Dark 41st Millenium with bolters, plasma cannons and Powerfists all combined into what promises to be a glorious struggle for Arkhona.

As you know the game is in Early Access so please don't expect a finished product but what you do get is the opportunity to shape the features and direction of the game before it's released. The developers are happy to communicate regularly with all the fans, answering your questions, incorporating ideas and feedback from players and even hosting a weekly Twitch show to keep you updated on the game's progress. The development is as open as it is possible to be.

Like I said, it's an Early Access title so there will be some bugs, crashes and glitches as more and more features are added but with each new update the game gets better and better. It's been amazing to see this game grow and I hope more of you will join us in our Crusade!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

CHECK THE END OF THIS REVIEW IF YOU ARE GOING TO CREATE AN ACCOUNT FOR THIS GAME OR BUY THE GAME

This game is what I consider a must-have either if you are a Warhammer 40k fan or if you are looking for a great MMORPG(not your usual MMORPG). For a long time I have been looking for a game that I wouldn't get tired of, it didn't matter if it was going to be f2p or not I just wanted THE GAME. Then I stumbled across this soon to be masterpiece game. At the time I bought it it felt like a shot in the dark since I had no friends playing it to show me how it was and the content shown by the devs was not much to judge if the game was worth buying or not. To my joy it was more than worth it the game even on Alpha phase was more than a lot of complete games out there.

For the gameplay right now although you can only use Space Marines and Chaos Space Marines the game is planned to have at least 4 major factions which will be Space Marines, Chaos Space Marines, Orks, and Eldars and within these factions you will be able to choose 5 sub-factions as different Space Marine Chapters, Chaos Space Marines Legions, Ork Clans, and Eldar Craftworlds. Dependent on the faction you choose (you can create up to 4 characters of any faction without buying a new character slot) you will start your game in a giant battlefield against another faction and you will need to capture objectives to make your faction win in a brutal and adrenaline packed combat. The game is a TPS where you make the build of each of your 5 classes in (different for each faction) or chose the Preset which can inclued firepower in one hand and melee in the other, jump packs, healing specialities, shields, big guns and grenades and/or med/ammo packs. (THIS IS ALL ACCORDING TO THE AVAILABLE CONTENT THAT IS PVP ONLY AND INCLUDES ONLY A CAPTURE MODE, BUT IN TIME PvE AND OTHER CONTENT WILL BE ADDED TO THE GAME).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wellp guess the NDA is down now. I've been a founder since day one and what I will say about this game in comparison to the flood of other 40k games, and similiar third person multi player shooters is that it has, hands down, one of the most commited, respectful, and diligent of any devs I have seen in years. DO NOT BE TURNED OFF BY A CURRENT STATE OF THIS GAME, I can say without doubt they are working hard to perfect this title with each, frequent update, and even since early alpha I used to joke about how I wished I had never bought Star Wars Battlefront around last Xmas, as Eternal Crusade has had nearly as much, or more, content than that game since early Alpha. The only caveat was this game ran like ♥♥♥ in early alpha due to well, an alpha game engine, now however with recent updates I've noticed the game running like silk, and looking way better.

So in summary it has solid graphics, runs great now a days, and is a seamless shooter with great potential for class building, squad/clan gameplay, PvP WvW(ish) conquest, and as far as they've announced eventually PvE agaisn't things like Tyranids and Imperial Guardsmen I believe. If any of that interest you to foot the bill, and your looking for a steady shooter for a while, I'd highly recommend checking it out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ignore The Plebes who can't read or research before playing for .3 minutes.

QA Manager | Community Rep. | Ork Weirdboy
Warhammer 40,000: Eternal Crusade Dev team
--------------------------------------------------------------
To everyone asking about optimization (if anyone would like to help me out by making a gif or a pretty banner, that would be greatly appreciated!):

It's not common place to perform huge groundbreaking and noticeable optimizations during alpha, because when assets/maps/objects/characters change, those optimizations need to be re-done. That creates extra work.

As a result, most games (even AAA ones!), will only perform hardcore optimizations in beta, when content is locked or is changing less often.

Short-term suggestion: If the performance is too unbearable for you at this time, try to turn the graphics down a notch or two! It won't look as gorgeous, but it'll be more fluid!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is based on a first impression, so take this with a grain of salt. The game is poorly optimized, set to the highest graphics setting and resolution the game plays at a crawl, with a terrible frame rate. I've read that if you lower the settings it becomes more tolerable, but that is hardly a plus in the game's favour.  The game offers very little content for the price it's asking. This game will feel familiar to anyone who has played Space Marine both visually and gameplay wise for the most part, with the addition of vehicle combat. It has solid visuals and when I wasn't suffering frame rate issues the weapons and gameplay was well executed with good weight behind everything. The game is supposed to be improved as time goes on with new content and races being added in and I personally am excited for that. As it stands this game is a very hard sell even to fans of Warhammer 40,000 and I would seriously advise waiting until the game is properly optimized because as of right now it is not worth the amount they are asking for it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very early in development, still a fun game to play. Now it is a 16v16 PVP arena mode were you can have quite fun for several hours. The future of this game has a big potential with an open world territorial conquest and character progression it will be a great game to play for hours.

Sure it has some perfomace issues, but lowering the graphics helps a lot. Don't buy this game if you are expecting a finished game, it is absolutedly not. Buy it if you are interested in the game and want to be somewhat involved in the process of development. Expect major changes in the game during its live, so if you don't like something go to the forums and discuss about that. That is how an early acces work in my opinion.

I have played many hours and I would continue to do so because I'm having much fun with this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

F.Y.I. This is the most toxic community I've encountered since League of Legends.

I've been following Eternal Crusade since the beginning, and it was one of my most anticipated games, especially since I was a huge Dawn of War, and Space Marine fan.  When we finally got access to the game though it was completely lackluster and not at all what I expected. What I expected was at the very least a fun warhammer game, but I was mistaken. Eternal Crusade doesn't really have anything noteably good about it for the type of game it's trying to be. It's stuck in confused state of being between a 3rd rate planetside and Space Marine but taking none of the good qualities of either and mixing only the bad of both.  For example it's not truly open world like it was originally advertised as, everything is matchmaking based rather than territorial conquest, which would be fine if the gameplay was at least fun but it's extremely redunadant.  The executions look pretty at first but when you realize you're locked in a 20 second animation that you can't get out of, 90% of the time you're going to die if you use it.  While they offer multiple classes only 3 are really valid choices. The tactical and ground assault are the only one's who can capture terminals which invalidates pretty much everything else on that basis alone, but you'll find out that vehichles pose literally no threat and are more like gimmicks than having any tactical advantage. Again tactical has melta bombs which is antivehichle so just throw 2 on and the vehichle is gone, which is significantly faster and more efficient than any anti-vehichle weapon like the lascannon which is literally useless. Unlike in Space Marine where you could use the weapon as a sniper rifle of sorts, this lascannon in this game uses a lock-on firing mode which means you have to hold the aiming reticle precisely on a target for 30 seconds before it fires. That means it's impossible to hit infantry unless they stand absolutely still for the full 30 seconds, and on vehichles it takes well over 10 shots to do even a significant amount of damage.

When you go down nobody really bothers to pick you up so instead of wasting 30 seconds just sitting there it's normally faster to just kill yourself to try and speed up the already absurdly long respawn process. Another example of a bad planetside trait this game borrows. You have about a minute to wait before you respawn which gets old very fast.  Melee doesn't feel satisfying in any way and is very broken at the moment.  Overall everything is just extremely redundant and lackluster, you don't feel anything refreshing in the gameplay. Once a match is over you kinda just sit there and look at the clock and go Wow...did I really just waste 40 minutes playing this game?".  Space Marine is 100 times more polished
recommended: so if you want a good warhammer multiplayer game go grab that while It's one sale because Eternal Crusade will never be up to par. Needless to say I was very disappointed after following this game for years and I wish they could have done better but the Devs aimed for something grand scale but ended up missing their mark. They tried and I'll give them that but there was some issues with the funding and nothing turned out like it was originally intended.\n\nIf you get the chance to play for free
hoursPlayed: then by all means give it a try and make your own opinion
voteText: but I warn you now you will regret it if you spend $40 on this. It's barely worth $10.  Even if it was entirely free I still wouldn't play it anymore because it's not fun

reviewText:
Early Access Review

How to start... Eternal Crusade has a great potential, and I am one of the founders - the fact that biased my judgement. Even with that, I cannot recomment it as of now.

This game has a lot of problems: balance, unoptimised graphics, lags and all of them are kinda expected from early access game. I was very positive with early builds of it but now I have big concerns. Concerns about development.

First of all, it's the problem with weapon and class balance which was present since the day of launch, but hey, many months passed and devs actually did many balancing passes and situation didn't change for better.

Second, the problem with map and game mode balances. Maybe pug statistics says otherwise, but in case of coordinated teams map/mode combinations almost always have a strong one-sided advantage which could be prevented by simple common sense.

I pray for better, ready to worse.

Will update this review from time to time and I hope at some point I will make thumbs up for the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Exciting. Fast-paced. Plenty of action. Once you enter the fray, the combat is laid on you thick and heavy. There's little time to try and formulate some complex idea. Fire until there's nothing else to hit, or slash and chop until they've all dropped.

The game features a very enjoyable experience for an early access game. Naturally, there's bugs. There's crashes, problems, ect. It's early access. These come with the label. They work on them quickly, practically releasing a new update once a week. They listen to the community fairly well, and have a good idea on how to approach balancing issues, which is difficult when a game features both ranged and melee as viable and effective ways to kill your foes.

The maps are fairly average. Some design flaws here and there, and honestly I feel like there could be more improvement in this department. That'll come with time as the developers listen to our feed-back and things get beaten down through trial and error.

Despite the fast-paced, high-action content, you have to pay attention to yourself and your allies as much as your enemies. The slightest mistake can cause you to get killed while fighting. Missing a key headshot where it counts can mean you'll lose the ranged duel. The melee system is currently a rock-paper-scissors mechanic, and is still going through constant changes and balancing.

Orks and Eldar will be put into early access fairly soon. As of this review, only Chaos Space Marines are in. Three Chapters/ whatever you dirty heretics call it, are in the game. More will be put in as time goes on. It's expected more races will be added via DLC/expansions after the game has been released.

As of this current review in its current Early Access? I have a lot of fun. The combat is addicting. The classes offer a different approach to the game, none of them feel alike. I've sank hours into this game as it is already. It'll only get better from here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The first thing you need to remember about this game right now (27/02/2016) is that this is EARLY ACCESS.  This is very important to remember.

The next point I want to make is that considering this IS early access I really enjoy the game.  This gives me confident optimism that it will deliver more good things as time goes on (it is essentially going to be an MMO so its development is constant).

With these things in mind you really have to ask yourself the big question as with ANY early access which is whether you want to pay for a game that is not finished yet.  Try and base it on these facts (correct on the date shown above):

The most important thing to consider is that if you enjoyed playing the multiplayer mode in the game Space Marine you will essentially like this.  It is the exact same concept however cleverly expanded upon in gameplay mechanics with things like cover, healers, picking up fallen team mates, resupplying your ammo and especially vehicles.

You should remember however that the game has not yet reached MMO status in terms of battle size and there is no persistent world yet either.  We are a fair way away from this.  Currently in early access we are in effect helping BeHaviour test out the combat mechanics so that the core aspect of the gameplay will work.  This is so that as the scope of the battlefield expands the action remains consistent and enjoyable.

Not all of the races, weapons, complete loadout options or customization options are available as yet.  If you are looking to play anything other than Space Marines or Chaos you are out of luck.  Eldar are due to be released over the next few weeks and Orks will be some time after that but definitely before release.  You also need to remember that if you are looking to define what your character looks like and / or pimp out their accessories this is not yet available.  It will definitely be coming in the foreseeable future and in a big way but is not currently considered key to testing the core combat mechanics at this point in time.

The game in effect currently plays like a lobby based shooter.  As mentioned above the more meta-level of the game with connected territories and a persistent map is not yet available.  As a result we currently have a handful of maps (presently 4) that are randomly cycled through with X vs X number of opponents.  Whilst this is a far cry from the end game we can eventually expect it does essentially play like the multiplayer mode in Space Marine, just on a more epic scale.  As I said above, if you enjoyed that gameplay then this early access is worth it for that aspect alone.

Be aware that there are bugs.  As with ANY game there are always some issues.  To add to that this game is EARLY ACCESS and is changing at such a rate that sometimes minor issues arise.  Fortunately the cause of the issue is also the solution to the issue as well as also being a comforting thing for an early access game.  It means that things are developing and changing.  Progressing if you will.  It also means that the balance is meticulously being monitored and tweaked to ensure that it will be just right and not rushed out the door totally broken when released on general sale.

The developers are refreshingly active, open and communicative with the community.  Theyare closely monitoring the early access action and are involved on the forums listening to our feedback and helping the game develop into what WE want it to be rather than what is just the easiest thing to push out the door.  We get relatively regular updates (patch wise) as well as consistent Twitch video shows with the developers letting us know what is going on and what we can expect in the near future.

Finally, if you are a die-hard Warhammer 40k fan, who enjoys a good FPS game, this is also a fine choice just for that.

In closing, REMEMBER that this game is in EARLY ACCESS and currently has minor issues from time to time.  These are constantly being tweaked as the game develops.  If you are expecting to play a FULLY finished and COMPLETELY polished game, I would hold back and wait for release.  If the rest of the above description hasn’t scared you off, it sounds like you are really gonna enjoy buying this.

Hope to see you in glorious battle!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Keep in mind this review's for EA Alpha (Feb 1st 2016) and that the point at which you're reading this review may have had newer features that would improve my views on it otherwise.

I'm not a die-hard fan of the WH40k series but I have enjoyed its non-tabletop games as they come. Seeing this as an attempted mmo take on their TPS Space Marine, I decided to set aside my concerns about it being in Alpha and give it a shot. While my concerns ultimately became regrets, I would be lying if I said the game, what it stands for, and what it may become, is outright disastrous and not worth trying.

From the perspective of an alpha player, I can pleasantly see the promise this game has. Being able to play only as Space Marine or Traitor Marine at the moment, the choices of loadout and map are fairly limited but self-explanatory as to where to go, what role to serve, what actions and approaches you can make once you familiarize yourself with each map. Weapons are all familiar and self explanatory, with very little complexity in what does what, and objectives are likewise straightforward. The game has a long way to go but what could be lying further down the road may very well be in the longest time what WH40k fans have tried to find.

From the perspective of an intermediate-level shooter-games player, this was an unbelievably disgusting nightmare of a game to try. Graphics requirements will give anyone with inferior hardware a bad time as high graphics settings give you a very good picture but tons of lag (and tactical disadvantage) while low graphics make it harder to spot and identify your enemy short of cross-referencing with the minimap and even at lowest graphics the game itself becomes choppy-feeling (still tactical disadvantage). Bad aim (and/or bad graphics compatibility) and bad loadout against veteran players of a stronger build can easily overwhelm you and while it takes you longer than 10 seconds to kill one player as he dances around slashing your allies to ribbons, you often find yourself bleeding out on the floor in less than 3. And the biggest problem of all: no key bindings system. Your controls are whatever the system sets it as so you're gonna have to memorize and utilize all the controls given to you on the fly, which will make things hard if you just jumped into a game and harder if you use keyboards or mice that are built in such a way specific buttons are hard to press in certain ways.

At the moment there's only public matchmaking so expect to have yourself thrown into a map with both new and veteran players...and because of the lack of tutorial, lack of controls customization, and potential graphics issues affecting gameplay, expect to be butchered by the latter for up to a good ten matches before you start to understand how things work and try to turn the tables. If your tolerance for being abused as a gamer or enthusiasm for the WH40k universe is fairly high, this could still work out for you but otherwise, like myself, give this game another few months...maybe years...so they can hash out the graphics and add a few more features that will rid this game of the many frustrations alpha tends to carry.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Eternal Crusade...  Holy ♥♥♥♥, I know this is in early access and there are people screaming and crying 'its in alpha' here and then, but I remember other Alpha games that didn't stray too far from alpha while still adding onto it.  This review is from the perspective of a strict Space Marine player.  I've never been on the delivering end of a Chaos's bolter, and I don't think I ever will.

This review was written on the TENTH of APRIL, 2016.
Only an idiot would bring up future patches to contradict this possibly OLD review.

TOO LONG, DIDN'T READThe game is pretty bad at the moment, and it's the better idea to sit back and watch as it progresses to see if things get better or worse for it.  It has some good aspects, but I can't say they outweigh all the negatives I've personally found in the game.  Initially, I was happy with the game-- until I played it longer and found more personal evils to sneer at.  Maybe when not everyone is packing a one-shot axe and killing more of their own team in random sword fights than actually using a weapon, I'll give it a look.  The game is also pretty laggy at the moment, and the vehicles aren't much to write home about.

NOT LONG, I'LL READCONS
Melee is absolutely broken.
If you lack a proper melee weapon and go up against an enemy with a melee weapon, expect to get stun locked or one-shot by the game's ridiculous idea of melee.  The primary options for a range-based class are roll, keep running, hold shift, or die.  Rolling doesn't do much but prevent them from hitting you- which, even then, most Melee classes are able to LOCK ON to you and follow you, as each attack LUNGES them towards you to do an ungodly amount of damage and stun you.  Assuming you can't gun them down first (which they tend to have a lot of HP), expect a lot of chasing until an ally can take the heat for you.  Otherwise, melee units can 'duel' other melee units in a game of 'rock, papers, scissors' in a boring, bland hit-and-roll fest between them before they get Dark-Souls style ganked.

The game is extremely laggy.
The game seems to favor players who lag versus players who don't.  I've gotten to the point where I can't even tell if I'm the one lagging, or if they are, as I will see enemies move and stop in place, as if they're lagging, only to gun them down and then have them warp into their intended cover only to go into 'revive me' mode.  Sometimes, an enemy to my direct left will warp to my front.  I've also come to notice that some hits continue to register, even as I go into cover.  This has not only resulted in some infuriating melee and gunfights, but also resulted in some VERY undeserved kills.

The movement is clunkier than Relic's pathfinding and makes the RTS-game units seem more intelligent than EC's marines.
I've gotten caught on many small objects and been unable to step up a very small, meager ledge multiple times that commonly meant life or death.  I understand, giant men in big power armor waving chainswords and .75 millimeter guns around aren't going to be the most mobile people..  Except they are.  Regardless, I've been finding myself caught on small things, unable to climb things I should be able to climb and unable to traverse what I should be able to.  On the bridge on the way in to a map where you storm a fort, after you blow the gate, I've seen and been the victim of some ungodly tossing and throwing of my Rhino or Vindicator or whatever by the afformentioned small, unimportant stuff that can send your vehicle, figuratively, on two wheels.

The vehicles feel like cars.
This isn't a joke either, the Rhinos have VERY little weight to them and move awfully fast versus what I've seen throughout the games.  Plus, as mentioned before, they tend to get stuck and caught a lot on very small, unimportant things.

At the moment of writing this review, there is VERY little to do.
Keep in mind, there are bound to be positives in the future, but as it stands, it's nothing but deathmatching and there are few maps with no difference in game mode beyond 'control point' and 'siege'.  Visually, there are very few differences in the CSMs and the SMs and I've found myself- when aiming down the sight, unknowingly shooting an ally because their 'friendly' marker doesn't appear when you aim.  The only telltale sign is the edgy black coloring most of them have and their goofy looking horns.  (hence why I main Space Marine, horns are for nerds)  Also, matches last too long if the defending side is good at defending.  The base time for the 'siege' game mode is thirty minutes.  That's an hour for one games.  Shorter if the attackers manage to break through in time.

Team damage and team killing is a thing, and you can be punished for dying to a teammate.
It's understandable for there to be stray fire, people aren't the most accurate Space Marines in the world.  However, Eternal Crusade- as it is now, loves to make it very apparent you can team damage and team kill, and it happens a LOT more than you think.  Melee fights in a one-Chaos vs four-Marines can turn into one-Chaos vs four-corpses, as in a melee fight, you CAN damage AND stun your teammates and potentially kill them, assuming the Chaos survives long enough to watch them slaughter each other while attempting to 'GET THE LIMEY ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥!'.  This is also apparent when using a Megamelta or a Heavy Plasma Gun, as you tend to kill everything infront of you if you don't die first.  This involves teammates.

Each team's respective unique class has a little more bang than they should.
The Apothecaries can revive Space Marines will full health and a temporary buff to them.  Aspiring Sorcerers shoot magic and boogers that do a lot of damage over a large range.  I don't think this deserves its own bulletin, but Raptors and Assault marines are also pretty ♥♥♥♥ing dumb.  Their jetpacks recharge fairly quickly, and they can dive-bomb-stun you and immediately begin sawing into you.
PROS
I got this for my birthday so that's pretty cool.

The gunplay feels pretty nice.
I don't think there is any gun in any game I've ever shot that has felt as comfortable as the Boltgun does, though I can't entirely speak for the large variety of weapons throughout the game- the bolt weapons take the cake.

It's gonna be free-to-play, and F2Ps only get to play Orks.
That's funny.  The game is going to utilize a 'Free to Waaagghh!!' system which allows you to try the game as an Ork with limited loadout options and abilities.  (Though, to some, this could be a con.)

This is probably the most tactical shooter I've seen in awhile, in terms of teamwork.
There is no one man to rule them all or going 40-4  with no teammates unless you, y'know, steal kills like a ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥.  Beyond that, I've found there to be a high level of cohesion necesarry between you and your team to win properly, and when it sticks, it wins.  Like a really big booger with really big guns.  Then again, I don't find many 'tactical shooters', so this is just a personal opinion.

The vision for the game looks pretty good, and the team is active.
They have podcasts every Friday where they show off what they've been working on for about an hour.  There is also plans for a 'cash shop' with 'premium currency', which is a personal con, but is a way to support developers who are hard at work.  There is going to be a system of war and dominance where you fight over a large map for control in a four-way fight between the Tough McGruffs, Peanut Gallery, Space Elves and the Mean Greens.  There is also plans for a Horde co-op mode where you fight Tyranids, which hopefully vary beyond 'hormaguant'.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EvR8yr6cG1c
This video glosses over the issues of melee and provides gameplay from ZoranTheBear who is to date with WH40K: EC.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me say, as someone who has been playing this game from the first moment it was available for founders to download, it is already one of the best Warhammer 40k titles I have ever had the immense enjoyment of playing.

You WILL see a good many people who say that this game is unplayable" and "broken". I can tell you with complete assuredness in my own experience that many of these reviews are by people who have no understanding of what this game is intended to become
date: nor the progression that it has gone through since it's early access was launched.\n\nFirstly
recommended: this is not a beta. This game is in an ALPHA state. What does this mean? It means you simply CANNOT expect it to have even a fraction of the features or development to be considered a complete game. Is it doing a damn good job of progressing? Hell. Yes. At this current stage

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As with all 'pay for Early Access', you are buying (usually at full price, or more) the right to play an unfinished game; Whereas the developer commits to nothing more than letting you play an unfinished game.  (That's just a summary of how it is.)

As for Eternal Crusade, it's a re-skin of the Unreal 4 engine developed and supported by Epic Games; Not bE who just does the artwork (which is nice) and scripts the environment (which is currently not good).  For bE's part, they are working on it, but after more than two years they still haven't added the Orks, Eldar, Tyranid, etc, etc.  And with the above EA commitment, they don't have to until sometime well after they 'release'.  Just like their 'goal' to make the Orks a 'free to play' aspect of the game ... where are they?  Right ...

Save your $$$, I'd wait for this one to finish and go into the discount basket.  There are lots of EA games that are actually worth it, or even 'free to play'.  Maybe someday EC will fit that bill, but it's not today.

As always, your choice;  Buyer beware.

Have an opinion about mine ... cool.
Want to be vulgar ... delete button is easy.
Want to pick a fight ... ban button is easy too.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI want to like this game, but it's so unoptimized that even my high end rig can't push more than 15 frames per second regardless of what the graphics or resolution are set to. It seemed odd since there's nothing special about the visuals. A quick look over the forums told me I definitely wasn't the only one with this problem, as many players report the game being unplayable due to the optimization. It also seems Unreal 4 itself is not the problem, since other UE4 games run just fine on my rig. It's just horribly unoptimized, even for alpha.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty much a waste of money at this stage of developement. It's really clunky unless you're standing still and not getting killed, then it looks great. The sound gets super choppy when you're under attack and fps is terrible almost all the time and I have a mid-sort of high level PC running it. I'm sad I spent money on this when it should probably be free to play until it's actual release then by all means I would pay that much. It's pretty much exactly the same as the Star Wars Battlefront that just came out, in that, it has zero replay value after you quit for the first time. I play it once and unistalled it just now after I sank an hour of frustrating spawns into it. There's not much explanation of how to play and the control scheme is definitely out of the norm for me because I rarely play games that have the scroll wheel click as a relatively main function.

In summation, would not recommend as it stands now, but with some latency fixes, bug fixes, many other fixes, and an answer to the question every game is faced with (why are we doing this? Is it just keep killing them over there and healing us over here? Or is there a point to this game? If not, why the hell did I buy this crap?)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nHas a LOT of potential. One upset for me is that at launch, nor have I read any post launch plans to bring in Black Templars, let this sink in.. In a game called Eternal Crusade, they do not have Black Templars THE chapter who upon founding swore to wage an eternal crusade, who have lead the longest crusade in the Imperium's history and still keep going. Sure we have the Fists but here, in this game, I would rather have Black Templars. Enough about my rant most of you won't really care about.. Besides this, great fun to be had in this early access. It's in a very early stage, yet I have had a wonderful time. In this stage of development I expected waayyyy more glitches than there are. As with all early multiplayer matches there are some bad spawns and balance issues I am sure will be fixed. They just put in the melee clash system not too long ago, it needs heavy improvment, and at this stage I cant say I like it. One last thing and I hope the devs read this, the shield is EXTREMELY overpowered, the lascannon's charge up time is too long to be useful in a meaningful way. I can't wait until they fix these things, like with the shield have the user take at least SOME damage instead of keeping it up until one of their buddies can come to kill you. I will still reccomend this game and can tell the devs care about the universe this game is set in. I can't wait until the PVE modes are introduced I am psyched for them!

TL;DR: Great Game 10/10 But expect to put many hours into learning it. Developers are friendly and very hard working!

If you like Battlefield series before they went to s***, you'll like this. If you've played Planetside 2 before, you'll like this even more once it's finished.

That being said, I almost refunded my game 6 hours in, not because I didn't like it, but because the learning curve can be steep. But I'm glad I stuck with it! Be prepared to put many hours into it to get good. People will come up to you as you're firing, and kick your ♥♥♥ with a sword/axe if you only have a knife. I recommend reading the melee guide.

Oh and did I mention the dev's rocked? They are pretty funny too! You can check out everything at

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game *WILL* or *SHOULD* be awesome....but honestly, its not there yet. In fact see Coe's post below. Its accurate and its supported be evidence. I played my time only a couple of months ago and I was shocked when I couldnt even traverse terrain properly....and by jesus did it feel pay-to-win. That is worrying because even if the game is fixed and totally awesome, it looks like it will follow the growing trend of death by microtransactions. I remember a time when you paid once for a game but the trend in gaming, not just in EC, is to pay for friggin EVERYTHING and its getting beyond a joke. I hope EC doesnt go down that path. I really really really want the devs to pull this off...but hold on to your cash until its released. Sorry devs but ive shelled out over $200 on this game already and I am thinking I shouldnt have. I second Coes opinion that at this moment the game does not look or feel like an MMO, it feels like repetitive team deathmatch.....and when I say team I mean a bunch of individuals that all look alike....and at the moment, whats even worse, is that your opposition looks almost identical to you...eh?

Early Access Review

For and Alpha, it has many bug, many patches, many stat resets and loads of random “WTF Happened to me” moments because of the high Ping you get because of the location of the servers ( I am playing from EU).

Yet the game is fun and has lots or potential in it and I keep turning back to the game even though it's a lobby shooter in its current state.

The Development team keeps the community up to date and almost every week there is a Patch with improvements or new weapons to test.

Can you handle the sudden changes and initial bad/broken/OP nature of new stuff that you are testing? (since you are testing an Alpha) then join the Fun on Arkhona.

If not, I recommend you wait and hold off until the game is fully released.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What do you get when you take Warhammer 40k. A tabletop game concerning huge battles and lots of killing and basically a ♥♥♥♥ load of DAKKA. And a Planetside like system. With huge battles and fantastic strategic gameplay? You get Warhammer 40k: Eternal Crusade.

I have been following this game for a while and i have always loved the idea. Huge battles in a 40K setting who would not want that? Idiots. Idiots would not want that. The series lends itself well to strategic games like Dawn of War but getting into the trenches yourself and taking up the chainsword is also a possibility. And that is exaclty what Behaviour has done for us here.

My reasoning for not wanting to buy in for so lang was fear. Fear of the developers cashing in on this great idea and then leaving after a month or two. Going on to other projects. But these developers. These developers are commited. They are figthing hard for a game that they want to play. And you migth think that rigth now this game is totally unfinished. WELL LOOK AT THE FREAKING THING ON TOP OF THIS PAGE! EARLY ACCESS GAME. Im sorry for screaming, but this game is currently in development. Thats obvious. They are first of all working on making the combat smooth as heeeell. And they are reaching that goal with thunderous steps.

I can not wait to see what Behaviour has in store for us. And i will follow them all the way into the Eye of Terror.
While this game has bugs, and weird things, and unbalanced weapons, and few races, and few maps. It also has AWESOME weapons, Cool as hell and polished maps and just. A team behind it who are fans of the 40K franchise, and who wants to see this game succeed.

I am not going to rate this game, because it is yet finished. But when it is finished, and believe me i cannot wait for that joyous day to come. I will be the first to stand upon the mountaintops of Holy Terra and sing the praise of this great game. Thanks for reading my review, or whatever. ALL HAIL THE MAN EMPEROR OF MANKIND <3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Date of Review 26/01/2016

Currently the game is in Alpha, the full title will be a overworld campaign based shooter ala Planetside, currently for testing purposes it is a team based arena shooter and a pretty damn good one at that.

The Good:

+ Enjoyable weighty weapons, bolters sound like bolters and its glorious.
+ Asthetic is spot on for Warhammer 40k, a lot of the models are based on the actual 'models' from the table top.
+ Huge capacity for team play, my clan have had a whale of a time enjoying the team based gameplay.
+ Good variety of classes, from Apothacary to Chaos Traitor the range works well.
+ Oodles of potential to become the next AMAZING MMO.

The Bad:
I have very little bad to say about this game that isnt related to its alpha status, but since you are paying to be part of the 'alpha' heres whats not too great about the current build.

- Optimization, Playing on about medium settings I pull around 30fps with my mediocer PC, but I have heard some horror stories on the forums and crashes do happen from time to time (Still runs better than ARK does though and thats been out for months)

- Voice Chart jankieness, currently the game relies on steam voice chat to supplement its own, meaning muting individual players isnt possible at this time, devs have said this is high on the list of changing.

- Nerfs and Buffs left right and center, currently being in alpha they are trying to work out the happy medium, expect new things to be OP and then nerfed a few days later, then brought up to a level of being useful again.

All in all I have MANY hours in this game and I say go for it, I dropped in a few months ago with the captain pack bought from the main site and I've only seen improvements over time.

If you do grab the game please use my referal key
EC-CYKBJIT5LVLWG
Thank you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all I'm a huge fan of the wh40k universe and I have played all the games related to this universe. I know its still in alpha but the buggs and balance issues are overwhelming for period of time the developer had to create this game. I have waited for this game long enough and I have bought every single word the developers said. I didn't mind all the big changes but the one that was game seller for me was the open world. Whats the point of strenght in numbers if you can only fit 20 or so people on the map. Was it so hard to just copy planetside 2.

These are the problems so far:
-I get shot thru cover
-getting stuck in cover
-cant get behind cover (why do we even have it???)
-the chaos sorcerer is a better healer then the apothecary (love the lore here)
-when jumping on some higher terrain I get stuck
-the precision on some weapons is godlike
-whats the point of vehicles if thers only a small road where I can use them on each map
-when Im in a melee fight my whole screen gets so dark I cant see a damn thing
-fast respawning
-I can't tell sometimes who are my allies and who are my enemies (I know all chapter colour schemes)

I will try this game in a few months again and if the same problems have not been addressed then I will ask for a refund.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review is after I purchased the game, played it for an hour and was frustrated, then got used to how it worked and had to stop as id played for 7 hours straight and not fed my pets.

Firstly there is something I must make clear, does this game in its current state have £35 worth of content? No, no it does not. However what is here is a dirty gem, just needing some gentle polish to become a beautiful diamond of a game, a game that will be remembered as the one true warhammer game of all time.

This game truely feels 40K, from how the bolter fires slowly and insanely loundly and you feel it as you fire, you feel the power in each shot true to the lore, as the rounds ding like hitting steel as you pummel a space marine from pointblank, how when you down a marine, you stand over them, pumping another 12 bolter rounds into them to finish them off, holy ♥♥♥♥! This is 40k right here. Your marine can take punishment, this isnt call of Duty you can survive a good smacking until you finally go down, this means 2v1 you will always lose, you cant go crazy and one shot everybody, you need to work as a team and a unit. If you round a corner and there are two tactical marines? Your screen will shake as you are pummeled by two bolters until you die. Team work is key.

PROS.

1) So 40k its more 40k than 40k.
2) Incredible team based gameplay, class system, loadout system with points.
3) It has great bolters, (I tried each gun once, used bolter for 7 hours straight)
4) This game has a great potential for being the game of the year if the developers can pull it off.

CONS.


1) This game is very early alpha, many bugs, lack of any content from discription, a long road until finish.
2) I wont list alpha problems, as its alpha, however if you purchase this game, like i say its currently not worth £35, you get a few maps to play and thats it.

However If this game delivers it will be worth £50 full release, so I still say buy now, if you like 40k and like tactical shooters this game is for you. This isnt COD this is warhammer!

The Aspertes will deliver the enemy to death! Forward brothers, do not fear!

Hard to give a detailed review atm being there is SOO much work that is being put in.  Short way of putting it: It's space marine that has been remastered and being made into a true warhammer 40k shooter(much like space marine should of been).  The idea is that it will match the lore and the actual table top, to a certain point(obviously)..

The fact that there will be hero classes and terminators(elites/heavy's) for each race is just exciting to know.  Giant maps with squads/guilds designed to match the groups game play(someone has a banner that buffs a certain stat, etc etc) is coming with the maps later on into development.  Game feels great for being in alpha, they have an impressive dev team.  Check out some of the known streamers to get an idea of the game.

My only gripe is the keybinds arn't in, but it is being worked on..  Waiting patiently... *whine* :(

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Warhammer 40k: Eternal Crusade aims to be the Planetside with WH40k setting with a 3rd person camera.
And you know what? I'll take a game like this any time of the day.

Currently the game is in early access (Patch #15 as of writing this) and has a lot of things missing (e.g. no persistent map, no orks, no eldar yet), and a lot of things need some additional love (e.g. performance, even though it became much better with last couple of patches).
But, with all that said - this game is amazing even in current state.

If you'd played Warhammer 40k: Space Marine multiplayer - this game is basically extended version of it.
It feels very close to the way Space Marine played. Gunplay is fun, melee system is pretty sweet (just mashing attack button won't get you far), maps are well designed.
In addition to all the parts from Space Marine, you have some new things of course.
For example - vehicles are good addition to general gameplay since maps are pretty expansive even now. And I imagine moving around on foot on persistent map would be near to impossible.

The game currently has two races available - Space Marines and Chaos Space Marines with Orks and Eldars coming later.
Each (current) race has 5 classes available: assault, tactical, ground assault, devastator and apothecary. (they are named slightly differently for Chaos side)
Each class has a distinct set of items and abilities it can use, and a unique way to be helpfull at battlefield.
For example, only tactical can capture bases. While only devastator can do anything to vehicles. And assault just has a bad-♥♥♥ jetpack and can fly.
Making classes have specific roles shapes the gameplay - even if your team is very good, but enemy has taken down your tactical, you won't be able to capture their base. I find that to be absolutely awesome.

Later down the line, along with PVP world map, the game will have PVE coop game mods.
Which in my opinion is fantastic, since I'm more of a PVE person.

But, as I mentioned, it's not all good in the land of WH40k. It's early access, so expectedly - there are issues.
My biggest gripe would be the framerate that is not quite stable yet (it's much better than at the game launch, but still not quite there).
The game also tends to occasionally freeze for short times after loading (for me), but that's more an annoyance than a huge issue.
Then there's rough UI and occasional crashes out of menus (haven't had any during the matches, though!).

If that doesn't bother you too much - you'll find a great PVP match-based 3rd person shooter with amazing community - just look at all those guides and fantastic discussions on official forums, also finding games takes seconds.
Devs are pretty active - patches come out regularly, updates on progress even more so, new features are getting added to the game. And in general the dev process is going quite good since launch day.

If you want to see more details about the game along with some gameplay, watch my video below:
https://youtu.be/TLjq5YG-0x4

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly, I can't yet recommend this unless you already have a love of Warhammer 40K. It's rough around the edges, it's not yet optimized, and some of the weapons feel a little off when you use them. Sorcerers and Apothecaries aren't too great unless you want to be a healer who's otherwise useless, and half the factions are currently unavailable.
Though what I can say is that what's there so far is fun, if a bit out of balance as of yet. I've been playing around in missions, trying out various weapons and roles, and I've had quite a bit of fun doing so.
Is it a finished product? Certainly not. Though it shows great promise.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is tons of fun because you can jump into the 40k universe and take the fight to the enemy, but I also think the game itself is still way too far into it's early stages. One main issue is how many Brothers kill their own mates. At first I thought it was by accident because it is kind of chaotic on the battlefield - no pun. I know a bad grenade toss, suprised squaddie, bad visuals, not knowing the controls or even lag can cause team kills and it happens from time to time. But then I noticed on more than one occassion people swinging their swords at teamates, dropping grenades by their feet or just shooting them with their bolters with no enemy around and for no reason. Infiltartors? Maybe, but even with the recent patch and penalties it still kills the fun of the game. Even on accidental friendly fire kills which everyone makes from time to time no one gets the benefit of the doubt they just get retaliated on by their own mates as soon as they respawn, which doesn't help the cause. Until they can figure out how to eliminate the teamkillers and griefers I'll stick to Space Marine. But I still would recommend you try it out for yourself because it does have a lot of promise. 7/10 stars

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Date of Review 26/01/2016

Currently the game is in Alpha, the full title will be a overworld campaign based shooter ala Planetside, currently for testing purposes it is a team based arena shooter and a pretty damn good one at that.

The Good:

+ Enjoyable weighty weapons, bolters sound like bolters and its glorious.
+ Asthetic is spot on for Warhammer 40k, a lot of the models are based on the actual 'models' from the table top.
+ Huge capacity for team play, my clan have had a whale of a time enjoying the team based gameplay.
+ Good variety of classes, from Apothacary to Chaos Traitor the range works well.
+ Oodles of potential to become the next AMAZING MMO.

The Bad:
I have very little bad to say about this game that isnt related to its alpha status, but since you are paying to be part of the 'alpha' heres whats not too great about the current build.

- Optimization, Playing on about medium settings I pull around 30fps with my mediocer PC, but I have heard some horror stories on the forums and crashes do happen from time to time (Still runs better than ARK does though and thats been out for months)

- Voice Chart jankieness, currently the game relies on steam voice chat to supplement its own, meaning muting individual players isnt possible at this time, devs have said this is high on the list of changing.

- Nerfs and Buffs left right and center, currently being in alpha they are trying to work out the happy medium, expect new things to be OP and then nerfed a few days later, then brought up to a level of being useful again.

All in all I have MANY hours in this game and I say go for it, I dropped in a few months ago with the captain pack bought from the main site and I've only seen improvements over time.

If you do grab the game please use my referal key
EC-CYKBJIT5LVLWG
Thank you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME AT THE MOMENT UNLESS YOU DO IT TO SUPPORT ITS DEVELOPMENT

Now that the disclaimer's out of the way, let me explain myself. This game is, in its current state (january 26th 2016) not good at all. And that's understandable, because it's an early alpha. Which is why it SHOULDNT be sold on steam early access. It's not ready, it's too rough, there's little to no content, the gameplay is rough, the optimization is horrible, and I could go on.
While the game has potential and I hope it will become the game we were promised as founders, I would just say do NOT buy it in this state UNLESS you do it to support the devs.
The game is simply not close enough to being finished at the moment and you would have a better time buying any number of finished games. Spending 50$ on this game and expecting to spend dozen hours having a blast is just not realistic in the state the game is in at the moment. If you have enough disposable cash and want to the support the develoment like me and all the other founders do, buy it, otherwise, buy a finished product that you can actually enjoy right now. You'll have plenty of time to get the game when it gets closer to being finished.
So again, buyer beware : I will definitely recommend the game and change this review when it becomes closer to release, and closer to a good, playable state, but it's just not the case at the moment.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been following the game since its annoucment and have dropped over a $120 on this game. Saying that you might think my review is a bit on the fanboy side. Is this game perfect? No. Is this game good? Yes. Can this game be great someday? I believe so.

Warhammer 40K: Eternal Crusade a true early access game, I would only purcahse if you wish to support the game and the great devs behind the project and can deal with bugs,changes and so on.

I have watched many twitches and posted many times on the forums critizing and also giving props when due. I will be the first to say I did not wish for this game to come to steam EA but the project leader Nathan eased our minds.  If you buy this game PLEASE TAKE PART ON THE OFFICAL FORUMS!!!!!!!! You will find a lot of help from the great staff at bE and from also the community. They really do take what we say and ask and make those changes in game.


+ Very active dev community - If you have a problem,concern or want a change they always have a answer.
+ Action Packed - Its a warhammer game the dakka is strong,
+ Team combat, Voip
+ Some Textures and animations look amazing!
+ The prospect of a great future

- No optimization yet, but FPS does get better with their weekly updates
- Core Features are not in the game yet, but are coming
- No massive battles
- Some Textures and animations look bad!
- Melee combat needs to be worked on
- Keybindings

Eternal Crusade can be one of the top MMO's we see. With PvE, massive PvP battles over a conquest map, skills/Traits, marks of chaos, Eldar,Orks, Weapon/Armor skins, factions and just the lore of warhammer that is planned on being in the game in the future this is a must buy if you are willing to take the risk. If you get this game right now as of Jan. 2016 do not expect a AAA game but a true work in progress alpha. It's up to the devs to deliver and I believe they will do so. If you are looking to help out come join the WAGGGGH!!! and may the Emperor Protect. But keep a eye out for this game if you choose not to help.
